_ZiHyed72zOzZVuSYdrHPQ.text: Very average and tends to be Overpriced. Based on two visits with our family I doubt we will return as there are too many high quality options in Charlotte.  Also -- avoid the Sunday brunch!!  Food was variable and not worth the price. Eggs Benedict and shrimp-grits were very good. Carvery, jumbalaya, and soup were not up to standard.

jqNKMxBskvD3yk6W6YSM9A.text: The service was excellent and the entrees were served in a timely manner. The menu offered many different options. We were a party of 4 where 2 people had different salads, the other 2 had salmon and prime rib entrees. We all thought our selections were excellent. We will be back!

KCPqQvtIvr7n9cYX0oWIoQ.text: The crab cake entree was yummy!  The crab cakes are on the small side but there wasn't a lot of filler so they were majority crab.  They serve with fries (I substituted for succotash) and cole slaw (which was very tasty).  I would be interested in coming back and trying some of the other entrees!  Oh and the manager and staff were very friendly :)

sYfpz6HwLDVTGsSSI2kqxw.text: Dinner was fair I had the filet, asparagus and broccoli . Pasta boulanaise was good. He also had coconut cake huge slice service was average. We have been here before and I enjoyed my meal much better the last time.

EMXcI-rjlORSMADyzctNfw.text: Great food, extensive menu, excellent service. The blue cheese chips are amazing, and the best coconut cake ever!  Jordan was a wonderful waitress. Very enjoyable evening.

KfxzARpYrbwSLCMb4pv9og.text: We had a reservation at 645, sat immediately. Someone brought water. Then no one came to our table till 730pm to ask for drinks. The only reason someone even came over is because we had to flag someone down. Not one server even looked at us or asked if we had been taken care of. So after 730, we ordered finally around 8. Waited another half hour for food. Seriously they weren't even busy. Then when we got our bill, the amount for a drink we had ordered was 6.00 higher on bill than what the menu said. Had to call manager over to correct. Seriously worst service and so slow! And expensive for food quality! Went one time 3 years ago , tried again tonight and never going back!!:(

wDT3G17sIe2hFJPyP5oNFQ.text: Best happy hour in Ballantyne. Lunch prices are good and food options are plentiful. I got the BLT flatbread and the bread was tough to chew but flavorful.

Izolx3segOsQiGr-vQ6iTg.text: What can I say about my recent experience with Vine....my parents and i went here Friday night for dinner and we have NEVER had a bad experience before but oh boy...Friday was an experience. The waiter was very off his game...i don't even know if he knew his own name or what day of the week it was. Took him forever to bring my wine, i arrived about 10 minutes before my parents and he didn't bring it until after they arrived and ordered their drinks. We were delivered the wrong order which was a different tables. They have a $1 bread service which is free refills...since when do nice restaurants ask you to pay for bread?! Bizarre. Our waiter forgot to put in our jumbo wing order, so when they came out they were right before our food and they were not jumbo. Hooters gives you bigger wings than this place. They did have a good smoky flavor to them though, i think this was the best part of our me. I ordered a cup of the tomato bisque as a stater and what i thought was a piece of plastic was in my soup so I could not finish it. The manager came over and informed me that it was not plastic, it was the outer skin of an onion. I informed her regardless of what it is it's inedible and not suppose t one in there.  Our food finally came out and it was terrible. My dad's prime rib sandwich was tiny, i think a Chick-fil-A sandwich is bigger. His fries were cold and greasy. I ordered the pear roasted salad with salmon. The salmon was cold and the pears were straight out of the can. They were gummy and chewy. There was nothing fresh or roasted about them. My mom's flatbread was burnt on the bottom and you could tell it had been sitting because the cheese was hard. The manager came back to check on us and we informed her this was the worst experience we have ever had probably at any restaurant and everyone needs to get it together. She covered our tab and also gave us a $50 gift card. Which was extremely nice of her. She is the reason why i am giving this post 2 stars when really i probably wouldn't have even rated it...we did love this place. We even had my moms 60th birthday party in the private room. We probably won't be back for a while until they can take the time to work on things. Definitely prefer 131 main over Vine.

1VOCrX-o95V_DuuPQN4MoQ.text: Ok - rainy Saturday afternoon - check list in hand, get up, check, get dressed, check, go to yoga, check, lunch, check - darn - still raining - okay it is now our duty to find a quiet spot for afternoon libations near a fire place - Vine - check!    Had the entire space around the fireplace to ourselves.  Our cute waitress was always on the watch for empty glasses but never hovering - hate hovering - also tried some apps - potato chips but without the described blue cheese sauce - very good and guacamole - usually do not order this unless I am in a Mexican establishment but remember, it was raining - so threw caution to the wind and was not disappointed.  Definitely want to go back to try a full meal.  Again, service was fantastic and the soft furniture in front of the cozy fireplace was the place to be on Saturday.

oVdVPDAwi8ngJ35msRfWPA.text: I visited for the first time during Restaurant Week. Their  RW menu was one of the weaker ones that I have seem BUT they did include a glass of wine, holler! The overall  regular menu was typical, steaks, burgers, chicken, fish, salads and sweets. There really wasn't anything specifically that knocked my socks off on the RW menu. I had the salmon (which I hardly ever order because it seems there is  a phobia here in Charlotte to prepare Salmon medium rare). It was very good, cooked to perfection and laying on a bed overly buttered mashed potatoes. I personally am not complaining, I'm just warning you. I think it also came with a few spears of asparagus but I can't remember. Clearly they were not that impressionable or I would have remembered. The dessert was a cheesecake with cranberry sauce drizzle. I question whether it was made in house and the portion size was disappointing. A  graham cracker square sized slice does nothing for this girl.   The atmosphere was cozy ( a little loud because of the live music in the bar) and the server needed to find another profession. It was very apparent that she did not want to be there. Came over one time after our dinner arrived and then gave us the check.  I would go back. It's a good general type place with something for everyone.

zTGbnc-5QSwYHnvW2PA5KA.text: I think it is necessary to give a little back story before getting into my review... I called earlier in the week to ask about their reservation policy because we had a party of 8.  When I spoke to the hostess she indicated I had to speak with their event planner for a party of "our size" because they can't really accomodate that many and they don't take reservations.  No call back so I called again 2 days later and left another message.  The event coordinator called me back eventually leaving me a pretty rude voicemail reiterating that they only have one area by the bar that can seat 8 people and their banquet room was booked already.  She proceeded to say that they anticipate about an hour long wait for a party our size.  From the very beginning I felt like having a party of 8 was the biggest hassle!  I called back and asked to talk to a manager since this was a bday and we wanted to at least have some type of communication that this oversized party was coming in.  The female manager was not very helpful and just simply said they aren't really set up for larger parties so I can try to call ahead and they will just do what they can.  She just acted rather snotty and once again as if this was majorly inconvenient.  Not impressed at all!  Quick wrap up...we were sat right away.  The waitress was pretty nice.  The place is big...nicely decorated..not intimate...looked like a chain restaurant from the inside.  We ordered the guacamole and fried green tomato apps and they were both pretty bland and small portions.  Some tried the ribs, the flatbreads, salads, burgers, etc.  Everything was just ok.  One member of our party didn't get his food until we were all done due to the waitress's mistake.  It happens, but no manager apology, and really it was barely mentioned by the waitress.  She did offer a free dessert at the end so that was nice.  The banana cream pie wasn't good, the key lime pie was super tart and the apple crisp was the table's favorite.  Overall, the food was average at best. The service was average  For the price point, you can do better.  I wouldn't return.

aHwr4rvXOoTXeeWsI6xrZA.text: Two pieces of hair found in my food today.  I'm sick to my stomach and will never eat here again!

tYDfEgvWlqROyWI93adcNA.text: This was my first trip to Vine and the wife and I had a great meal.  We ate about 8pm on a Friday and were seated promptly in the terrace room.  The restaurant was not very crowded overall as we noticed available tables in different areas of the restaurant.  The terrace room where we were seated is off the bar and has a big fireplace, which would be a great place to enjoy a drink and some appetizers.  We were greeted by our server Leanne within a couple minutes for drink orders.  I was in the mood for a beer and the server mentioned that they had just tapped a new OMB summer IPA and she offered to bring me a sample to try before deciding.  I thought this was a nice touch without having to ask.  My wife ordered wine and I decided to get the IPA that I sampled.  They have a good wine selection with many wines available by the glass.  I thought the appetizer, salad and entree selections had good variety and offered some differences from other similar type restaurants in S. Charlotte.  I ended up choosing the New Orleans gumbo and the ultimate grilled cheese with slaw.  The gumbo was decent and the grilled cheese was great.  It was thick sliced toast with 3 or 4 different cheeses and tomatoes.  My wife had a corvina fish special with potatoes and asparagus which was very nice.     We finished the meal with an espresso for me and coffee for the wife.  Espresso tends to be hit or miss at these types of restaurants, but I found the espresso at Vine to be a good finish to the meal.  I felt the overall service was very good, attentive but not overbearing and well paced.  Based on some of the past reviews, they seem to be paying attention and working to correct any issues.    Vine will definitely get mixed into our S. Charlotte restaurant rotation!

hFXFuV3ZHdWx6eqfkmzjRA.text: Reviews sounded good. Wait staff must have had a bad day. Food was eatable at best. Plenty of places around this area with better food, service and presentation.

3bb3ADBXsj-COsCFxYjtKA.text: A friend and I came here for restaurant week. Was excited to try something new besides our usual hot spots. The restaurant has great ambiance and decor. Our waitress, Holly, was very nice. We both ordered the filet mignon entree. Mine was unevenly cooked. I requested medium but it was a mixed of medium and well done. I didn't send it back because it was seasoned really well and it wasn't that big of a deal to me. Just a warning for those that are particular about that sort of thing. The sides were Rosemary garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. The asparagus were huge and seasoned well. The Rosemary overpowered the potatoes so I didn't enjoy them as much. The dessert was a chocolate brownie with ice cream drizzled in raspberry sauce. The sauce was bad. The dessert would've been stellar with a different flavor which I found out later they also offer chocolate so be sure to ask! Overall a descent dining experience. I wasn't overwhelmed or underwhelmed. It's not high on my list to try again but if given the choice I wouldn't turn it down either.

gsVMRr21zr3F34EhAGk8_A.text: We went during Queens Feast; it was crowded but we were immediately seated with our reservation.  The salad was a little soggy but I'm aware with QF going on they have to prepare them ahead.  The crab cakes were delicious as was the Cajun filet.  Dessert, which we don't usually order, was good as well. Definitely going back.

xLDleWGIY8u8ijRA23EjCA.text: Great fit for Ballantyne.  Prices are very reasonable for lunch and/or dinner.  Great atmosphere and excellent food!  Shoe String fries would be my only complaint.    Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  I will be back for sure!

s7ktdGSR0GSFucxdMARx2Q.text: Friendly staff and good food! Nice atmosphere for a casual evening out. There is a bar and a lounge but also tables.  The staff was friendly but had a little trouble getting the order right. Overall not A dive bar and a good place for a date.

h0xoEOGMSLEKhoP5qLDpSg.text: Vine American Kitchen is fantastic. The lunch options are great for a client visit and there is always a great salad. My favorite special was a tuna steak with avocados over mixed greens.   My family likes to go for special dinners. We have been to two in the last month. My daughter loves the crab cakes...and the cappuccino cake.    Great atmosphere, great staff, and great food make this a welcome addition to Ballantyne.

3gQWwkM4ru4XH0HwggpJ7Q.text: We wanted an authentic northern fish fry and saw that Vine had fish and chips on the menu and were excited to try it. We sat at the bar on a Friday night and there were only several other couples. The service was slow and very inattentive but we finally get a drink and placed our order. When the fish fry arrived it looked like fish sticks rather than a solid piece of fish - it was mushy like it had been frozen and re-frozen - and the tarter sauce was pure mayo with no relish and was tasteless. The bartender never asked how it was or if we needed anything else - was slow to bring the check and never gave us eye contact. We won't be returning.

cL1se3eRqbkc7PPnSXTR5A.text: Jeremy provided excellent service. The New Orleans BBQ shrimp and crab cake appetizers were very good. The blueberry lemon drop was also good. Would definitely have them again.

5AA26xqpkkdlhJMgH6ef2w.text: A great place for dinner, lunch, or a private event! The crab cakes are the best you can find outside of Maryland. Held a recent corporate event there in the Fireside Terrace room which is great for a reception or dinner. Jeremy took great care of us! Be sure to try the chop house burger, excellent flavor and cooked to perfectly pink. Going there for dinner tonight to try their prime rib - if I can manage to not order crab cakes again, lol.

fv_pTTJjRnYEQddJrkS28Q.text: I like this place our server was great and filled every request. I ordered the stuffed peppers and they were delicious. I will be back

LlT_y59bCKDM3kE9eHKcqw.text: After dinner drinks and Jeremy provided excellent service. We enjoyed ourselves and forgot about the workday.

tcaofSY9YysDc1t9cMRbRw.text: We had a wonderful experience at Vine American Kitchen.  The food was delicious and the menu offered a wide selection for everyone to choose from.  Our server, Jeremy was excellent.  He was attentive, knowledgable and friendly.  We will be back for sure!

ihqOBaY2WgYCwJrP15hsGA.text: My personal favorite restaurant in Ballantyne.  I love it because they have some great salad options especially for those who prefer vegetarian and/or fish/seafood options.   Bar: predominantly vodka...but some solid options and great wine list.  Bartender is sooo nice & personable!   Fav Salad/Entree: Blackened Shrimp Chopped Salad - large portion, always fresh, great presentation and yummy!   Fav Apps: Guac - be prepared it's a large shareable; Cornbread and Crab Cakes   Fav Entree: Crab Cakes, Mac & Cheese, BBQ and Blackened anything!

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Shrimp Chopped Salad
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizer Guacamole.....

nd8JEdzi_ufJv78S0RYt0A.text: Went to Vine American Kitchen for Christmas Eve dinner this year because hey, who wants to cook before the big day?  Sweetie heard they were going to do a lobster thing, and we like lobster so we made reservations for 6 people.  Got there at 5:30 and was seated immediately.  The server greeted us immediately and seemed pleasant enough and we always appreciate them working the night before a holiday.  The menu is great here, they have a little something for everyone.  I decided to go with the Surf and Turf.  I also ordered a side salad....2 issues are that they have a strange offering of dressings.  I can appreciate variety and "different / floofy" dressings but I was told they don't have Honey Mustard and Ranch.  Strange right?  Anyway, I went with the Garlic Parm dressing.  There was a tremendous amount of time lapsing between ordering my salad and when I asked the server he said the "kitchen was backed up".  Young Man, I've learned a few things in my years....probably the biggest lesson is not to lie to people.  The restaurant wasn't crowded and it's just a salad.  Of course the salad comes out exactly one minute before our meals which is one of my biggest pet peeves when eating out.  They saw my displeasure and I told them to take the salad away and makes sure not to charge me for it.  The Manager and like 3 other people came by to apologize which was also annoying but we must move on.  The entree was OK.  The lobster was good, well cooked and tasty.  The "turf" left a lot to be desired.  CAB "Heart of Ribeye" may sound fancy on a menu, but the end result was a thin, poorly cooked cheap piece of meat.  Because it's so thin, almost sirloin like it was just filler and not at all tasty.  Everyone else was OK with the meal...nothing earth shattering good or bad.  I will say the server this evening wasn't on his game.  My drink went dry 3 or 4 times and I had to flag someone down for refills.    Not the best meal, and a reminder why I don't come here often.

KguQjm1Wv5E4nT6wMTJPUg.text: We are grateful for their GF compatible menus and great location. Our waiter Jeremy (& the kitchen staff) let us order sliced veggies to dip in their fresh tasty guac (the chips have gluten) and the White Pear Ginger tea was delightful. Those little details matter when it comes to having a healthy & delicious meal.

XY-k2IErdn4KcodTdWFl5w.text: Avoid the cornbread!  I ordered cornbread and a couple of other items to go.  After driving all the way home I opened the box. The cornbread was way over baked, dark brown in color, and actually burned on the bottom. Apparently, whoever packed this crap for me saw the same thing I did.  Sooooo instead of re-making it, the folks over at Vine took their grubby fingernails and picked off some of the burned portion from the bottom. See the pic.  This is how it looked when I opened the box (less a portion I had already cut off and tasted noticing the nasty burned taste.). I called the mgmt and after telling Jordan about this he "offers" to remake it and for me to drive back to them and get one they hadn't burned. He actually said that "was the best (he) could do." I'm not a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burned cornbread someone picked over to remove the black parts. Riiiiiight. That is perfectly acceptable.

jjzMrHtAwCQmVhCpf6lpMA.text: It was a quiet night for a Friday and we didn't need reservations but we had them. Memorial Day Weekend everyone heads to the beach. This would be a great place to unwind and have some cocktails in the bar outside Inside the cool was very nice relaxing and classy. We were here for a 10-year anniversary and it was great. All the wait staff from the hostess, bartender to the server theu were all great they were courteous and not afraid to talk. The food was excellent it was done very professionally and tasted awesome. If you go you have to try the desserts and their homemade cookies were fabulous. Haven't had coffee and a tea service. I will definitely be coming here again.

ofN_82cPFcsQxBd6AX4h_g.text: Great ambience, nice seating area, good food.  We had a large party of 17 and service was spot on, pricing was very reasonable, and good food.  The group ordered everything from a salad to fish and chips to grilled cheese w/soup to french dip, etc.  My fish and chips was spot on.  Lots of fish, large, flakey, lightly battered and delicious.  Cole slaw was eh, but i'm not a coleslaw guy so not to fair from my perspective.    I had a bite of the french dip and it was very tender and tasty also.  I'd go back most definitely.

gcn4U4Njp2lHe00jvVZJPg.text: Great food and service. This restaurant was exceptional. All that we ordered was great. their drinks were fabulous too.

y7oKyoY8XsaemCAPAvp-3w.text: Brittany is awesome!! She gives great service and truly loves her job. On top of being personable she keeps a friendly smile on her face. I'd recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a great cocktail, ambience and most importantly great service !!

m68BCdlZcgG1cblUHlyjBg.text: 8/18/17 5 of us had dinner tonight Prime Rib special was excellent  Fish & Chips excellent  JC our waitress was excellent  Will go back as often as I can   Had dinner here last night with my daughter and son in law and one of my nieces and everything was excellent   Service with Janes our waiter was very good with explaining food choices and specials  Prices are very good for value of food and portion size Will definitely be back

PhpX0vANV7FfUaoZzrfEOg.text: Check this place out!  I need some food for lunch yesterday but was in a hurry and I must give a tip of the cap to Vine even though they seemed busy. The service was good but the crab cakes and the kale salad with salmon were the best. Thanks again & we will be back, tell your friends!

ONOeZf8krNGN82p3s1UoGg.text: We went for New Year's Eve dinner and it was lovely.  They had live music and Jeremy our waiter was super friendly. The crab cake appetizer is amazing as well and the gumbo appetizer.  My husband had the maple chicken entree and loved it and the leftovers as well:) I would skip the Mac and cheese next time though as it was a bit bland and runny.

IheBFic-p7VPScTexw4mtg.text: Went for the prime rib special and it was just average. Service was ok but nothing to write home about. Given that adjacent restaurants are packed, I was surprised to find this pretty empty on Friday at prime time but it turned out that there was nothing special to come for.

p3o4R1mGTTXCpmJXkM9Ftg.text: Cute place just the food isn't that great. Ordered a Cobb salad and the salad came out wrong twice because of a misunderstanding. The bacon was old and the dressing was so overpowering. Overall not the greatest food, but service was good.

nsdQfh591FG79EbXbzQ17Q.text: First time here. Very nice ambiance! My plate was just ok, I had the half rack of ribs. On the other hand my husbands plate was great! He had the crab cakes and they were wonderful! Serviced by Judy she was super sweet! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

EW8NV01SDnNRcjYPshzPmA.text: The wife and I went to Vine American Kitchen for the first time on Saturday to check out the Queen's Feast menu. We were welcomed with open arms. The staff was nice and inviting. The hostess sat us and told us the name of our waiter. The waiter was very nice and professional. The wives enjoyed the wine. Both were pleased. The food was sensational! I had Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes. The cakes were so meaty but very moist and tender. The wife had the Cajun Filet Mignon. This too was very delicious. The filet was cooked to a perfectly medium rare temperature. The potatoes and the creamy sauce on top complimented each other very well. We felt relaxed enough to linger awhile and talk over wine and dessert after our meals. The only reason why this place doesn't get 5 stars is due to the fact that the lighting was very dark for my ambiance flavor. I like a nicely dim lit restaurant. But the lighting was so dim on Saturday I was confused as to whether it was bedtime or dinner time! But all in all, a great experience. Can't wait to get back there.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Filet Mignon....The bomb!
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent jumbo lump crab cakes!

JVyS6Ts2Z3DXS1OQRTKmMQ.text: Great new manager- terrible hostesses and sub par customer service. My opinion is don't go here- There is much I can say, but I will try to condense it. First of all-Do not go in here with a high expectation because it is in the Ballantyne area or because the outside looks nice.To begin with- we walked in and the hostesses were extremely rude and unwelcoming. They seemed snobby like they didn't want to be bothered. Not the best representation to have at the front of your establishment. As I watched, I noticed their level of customer service fluctuated depending on who they were servicing as well. When we went to be seated the waitress took us and asked "is this seat okay?" And when we replied that we'd actually prefer sitting more towards the interior (instead of in the back corner by the kitchen) she left us and went back to the hostess area like she had a problem. Why ask us our thoughts if you really don't care where we'd like to seat or if it would be such a problem? Then when we went to the hostess area to ask who we should be following for our table now- the hostess with blond hair say "excuse me?!" With a bothered attitude. I feel really  sorry for the manager who has to deal with this mess and hope he can clean house and make this restaurant what it should be. If you decide to go here- just don't have high expectations so you won't be disappointed by poor customer service.

F47w4uKqw-QAwzsYWtoy_g.text: We've had good food and good service here. My brother-in-law is a big fan of the chicken sandwich. It is your typical American food, but better than the average restaurant.

31kEdquBC3uxmzlc_LF_Ew.text: Good atmosphere, good food and good prices. Nice job on the renovation to open everything up. Jambalaya was very good!

slNP4_fyTfdjAJF08aN-Jw.text: First time here.  Sat in the area near the fireplace.  Good vibe until a large "supper club party" took over and the women started shrieking.  Service was a little slow but not unreasonable.  Food: excellent!  Had rotisserie chicken pasta with artichokes, asparagus, roasted red peppers, garlic, and a white wine sauce.  My wife had a shrimp salad.  Looked a little boring to me, but she seemed to like it.  We had a Vermont crumb bread pudding thing for dessert, with vanilla ice cream.  The ice cream was too cold, not very creamy, but the dessert was pretty tasty after we let it melt a bit.  Wine list:  good selection but not a True wine lovers list.  Didn't have vintages, so you couldn't decipher good years from bad.  And they call the place "Vine"?   Hmmm....just sayin'!  I give the restaurant 3.5 stars.

3FopE0RIejDJUjZYM7I2Eg.text: The chicken sandwich I ordered for take-out was pretty good. But I received such extremely poor customer service from both the hostess and bartender handling my order, I highly doubt that I will ever return. Such a waste of a beautiful location to have rude staff ruin it for the customers!!! I seriously hope the owners and management will make take some much needed corrective action!!!

hAt_hxTnmxioO6tqPXwI0w.text: Great new spot. Service was first rate & the food was very good. If you go on a Thursday they have excellent bottles of wine at half price.

z-TNgPrRYSOei22EhvwzNg.text: I took my teenage daughter here for brunch after church one Sunday and we have also been to Vine for dinner on a few occasions as a group and my fiance and I on date night. The positives: Service is USUALLY pretty good. Brunch was an exception, my bloody mary had been prepared by the bar, but it sat, at least 10 minutes judging from the watery mess from melted ice when it finally arrived at the table WITH our food, not prior. And it was tiny, served in a small bar glass. Dinner I rate a 3, it is pretty pricey for what you get, but the wine selection is good and there is a diverse menu. Brunch gets a 1. The food was overcooked, I will say they made an egg right after it was served and brought me another, but the portions were very small for the price and overall, not good. Their average for us gets a 2. It is never overly busy so if we go to Vine ever again, it will likely just be to have a cocktail in a nice environment

he26vKsSy6N810Qmkq07vA.text: I rarely give a 5 star rating to a restaurant but I couldn't find anything wrong with this place.  We arrived on a Friday evening and was promptly seated.  The place was about 75% full.  The staff was incredible from the hostess to our waiter, Marshall.  I was there with 3 friends and we were really looking for a good meal, good wine and a place to catch up with each other.  Within a minute or two our waiter arrived and asked it we would like to place our drink order.  We were still looking over the wine list and he then said he would get our water.  One thing that impressed me was he asked if everyone wanted lemons in their water.  I hate lemon in my water and have never been asked this.  One bonus point for Marshall.  When he returned he asked if we had any questions and we asked him several questions on the wine, all of which he answered, you could tell he knew the wines quite well.  When the wine came he asked if we would like to test it before he poured all of us a glass, another bonus point.  At this point I am wondering why this place gets such bad reviews but then again we hadn't had anything to eat.  We asked for some time to chat and he was very accommodating.  I despise going in a restaurant for dinner and being rushed.  He checked back with us a couple times and again we asked a few questions about the nightly special and he gave us his opinion on some of the entrees.  I had the pork which was amazing along with the house salad, the white balsamic vinaigrette was wonderful.  One of the ladies had the special which was a swordfish and scallops combo with house made pita.  She said it was also amazing.  The two other ladies had the salmon and they also said the food was great.  Marshall checked in with us a couple times to see if we needed more wine and to make sure everything was ok.  Before preparing the bill he asked us if we would like him to split the bill instead of just handing us one bill.  All in all it was a great meal, great service, great wine.  I will definitely be back.  BTW I am a restaurant owner and I look for flaws, I couldn't find one.  This will definitely be a place I come back to.

sLTmMsO_5zqzk-dxYgzWNg.text: My wife and I were staying in Charlotte over the holidays and ended up at Vine for dinner with our daughter.  The interior of the restaurant is spectacular.  There is a beautiful fireplace with comfortable sofas to sit on while waiting for your table.  For a large restaurant I appreciated the lack of background noise.  I have a little trouble hearing conversation with a loud "din" in the background.  As for ambiance, A++.  The hostesses were very friendly;  I was shocked to read some of the other critiques which labeled them rude.  This was certainly not the case with us.   Our food was excellent.  I had the fillet which was tender and moist and cooked just as ordered.  My wife had the crab cakes which she said were the best she'd ever eaten and on par with the quality of our favorite restaurant in Atlanta, The Atlanta Fish Market.  My daughter had the "chef's special" which she said was very good.  I ordered the gumbo which I enjoyed:  It was the perfect temperature and portion and very tasty.  My daughter got the soup of the day, butternut squash, which she let me taste.  Delicious.  We skipped dessert because we were sated and didn't have room.  Over all it was a great dining experience.  Our server, the owners, managers and chefs certainly deserve kudos for their efforts.  My wife and I dine out frequently and I can see that this will be one of our favorites and we will dine there every time we're in Charlotte visiting our daughter.  Too bad there's not a Vine American Kitchen in Atlanta.

eq3DcqX7HRCAhXK1FHWcOg.text: Great atmosphere with fireplace and a bar. The food was great and came out fast! Our waiter Jeremy was very friendly and made our visit comfortable and pleasant!

3_Yqxte2htAvVJiw-5nyHg.text: Chose to go here for an extended family birthday dinner. We arrived on a sleepy Sunday evening with virtually no customers there - easy to get a table!  Service was very good overall - we had multiple server coverage and she was great adjusting to the dietary and child food restrictions.  They have a great happy hour food special so we started with wings and calamari - both good, wings had solid heat. For our entrees we had a variety of salads, the prime rib special, the roast chicken, BBQ pizza and the tomato bisque. Of those the bisque and roast chicken were standouts, well seasoned, bursting with flavor and the chicken had great sides (sweet potato, Brussel sprouts). Unfortunately the prime rib was average - fatty and dry.  Overall Vine is a reliable choice in Ballantyne and a good alternative to places like 131 Main.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tomato bisque
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent roast chicken and sides
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Homemade Mac and Cheese

7W5hrkWOUhuwhJGs6TLgDg.text: Nice place for a quick business lunch in Ballantyne.  Nothing will blow you away, but it's consistently good.  Their crab cakes are my favorite thing on the menu.

VmQWdHZfLM0YsUgOQ9SDww.text: Had our Christmas party here.  The food was good and our waiter was Jeremy.  He was awesome!  Great evening and nice atmosphere.  Would recommend the ribeye steak, cooked to perfection!

BzTY0A8-j_09Gr9zsP537Q.text: Our service tonight was great! Jeremy, our server, did an amazing job of engaging with us while providing excellent service. I would highly recommend this restaurant and to ask for Jeremy.

glSY1bv6gfue8Qssw_2j-g.text: JERERMY is an amazing server that pays attention to detail. His radiant personality really sets the tone. He knows exactly how to treat his guests and makes them feel important by remembering what they have ordered in the past, or even their names. If you come to VINE sit with JEREMY !

KKwNJl-FGnQGw5UTdNcfww.text: My wife and I love Vine because of the assortment of food choices. We usually split the ribs because we start off with a margherita flatbread which is her favorite in the city! The ribs are the best because the meat falls off the bone and its sauced very well. Also, wine bottles are half off in Thursday's so it makes for a great night out.

L2_fbhkgOSlw5AkfvL22Qw.text: This place is my family Go To when guest are in town and staying in Ballantyne for lunch or just while out and about shopping.  The salads and lunch specials are my FAVORITE. I've added the Jalapeno cornbread and sweet potato bread pudding to my list and the fish sandwich they offered one afternoon I stopped in and sat at the bar (it was a special and not on the menu). The Pros: Location, vibe, several food items, the bar scene, the patio The Cons: The inconsistency of great service, this includes hostesses as well as wait staff going from AMAZing one visit to Uninterested the next visit.  I would recommend this place to others merely because it's good and in a good location and they may be lucky and get one of the AMAzing staff as their server.

Vh8KnMhGp_aWPFKlBxruxw.text: My wife was meeting a friend for HAPPY HOUR on Thursday.  Her friend arrived about 15 minutes before my wife. When my wife walked in her friend said had stood there the whole time and no one spoke to her. There were as many as four girls at and around the hostess station at one time while she waited for my wife. Not a single one of them acknowledged her, greeted her, smiled at her, asked her how many in her party, are you waiting for another person...they just stood there and talked with each other. Evidently the last thing on any of their minds was the guest standing in front of them.  It amazes me the lack of interest your employees had for this customer who would have helped pay her salary. Needless to say they left and then went to Stone Mountain Grill and had an enjoyable meal where they were greeted and treated with respect by everyone there.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

rQe5dZz-a0PzM-2PVWXa-Q.text: Every Thurs. it's half off bottles of wine. And if you are looking to up your experience, ask for Jeremy. He is the reason we come back for girls night!

MVWSsS5LH4hCMIqD6xmUdg.text: When someone suggests Vine, I immediately unfriend them on Facebook and reconsider my life choices.

75-gCd3wfgZcDJ_KKhHIEg.text: The food and interior were actually not too bad. The interior was cozy and inviting. Plenty of comfortable booth seating. There was also a nice group room with a fireplace that was being used by a family that night. It was surprisingly empty at 7:30pm on a Saturday night. The hostess was extremely rude and short. Our waitress didn't even introduce herself and almost ran away before I had a chance to ask her a question about the menu. It unfortunately got worse from there. We never received refills on our tea and waters. Our salads didn't have dressing tossed in. My date order an entree sized salad and asked for tosses in dressing and instead received a tablespoon of dressing on the side for an entree sized salad. It took 10 minutes to try to flag someone time and then another 10 minutes to get another side of dressing.   Service here was really lacking. I want to give this place another try because the food was actually pretty good. I would try sitting at the bar next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

jKrzmamlRNjQYedgqlAotg.text: We arrived on time for our reserved table. There were 2 or 3 young people managing reception. As is often the case, they were more interested in the banter between them or at least distracted by it than getting us seated. This, of course, says nothing about the food, but it does say something about managing staff at the first critical moment of truth. It all adds up. Better places get this right, of course.  The service was very good but the food was average. We both ordered the roast chicken with mashed potatoes and haricot green beans. The chicken was delivered like warm so we sent it back. The replacements were noticeably better but still not really hot. The mashed were fine. But the beans were a little too al dente to our taste and the sauce was muddy, the flavors indistinct. That was our main complaint with the whole dish; there was something  of a poultry seasoning-type flavor on all of it making it all kind of taste the same. This struck us as an overreach on the part of the chef trying to be too creative. Simple and clean far better and preferred. They comp'd the key lime pie which was very good, but sadly too little too late. We won't be coming back. 131 Main is far better.

nQ4Fl4xrxsPtY9W5xIuX0Q.text: Service was horrible.  Waited forever for our food.  Food was then not what we ordered.

wKUmW3LpEUejoSRRqFuo4Q.text: We decided to go to Vine last night as we had thoroughly enjoyed the Turkey Burgers in the past. On entering we noticed a sign for Happy Hour and asked what that entailed. The young lady greeter told us it was mainly food and not drinks and that we would need to sit in the bar area. We decided to sit in the restaurant.   After we had ordered we went online and discovered that Happy Hour also included some drink specials!  Our Turkey Burgers arrived and they were nothing like we had experienced previously. My husbands seasoned fries were so crispy that they were practically burned. My turkey burger was burnt to a crisp and inedible. We wrote on the bill. "Food was awful we will not return".

Xjm3cqR_a9BERkNpfAGpsg.text: I'd give it a 4.5 if we could do halves. We went on a Friday night and were a bit surprised it wasn't busier but no complaints as I like it a bit more quiet. Our waitress Jennifer helped with the menu and made great suggestions. I had the crab cakes and they were delicious. Luckily Jennifer asked if I wanted to substitute the slaw that comes with it, changed to the brussel sprout, cauliflower and onion hash, really good. My wife has a flatbread and that was great as well. Will definitely come back again!

zhA6TfuIc5ZbMqpVLlthpw.text: Love coming to Vine! The atmosphere is always welcoming, food is always great, and drinks are on point. Jeremy has been our server several times and always gives us a personable experience. Definitely recommend Vine!

mnNsY_vp9w99Ru0ScVcdKw.text: Jeremy made our night! Great meal and a great waiter! Wonderful food with my great friends. Made a Zac Brown concert cancelation better!

X-TISa2W-7tXdcIPHTkUGA.text: Pretty good food.  We had the gumbo and corn bread, fish and chips, burger and Caesar salad & max n cheese.  The burger and salad were not so good.  I liked the batter on the fish but it didn't have much flavor.  The cole slaw was gross, like powdery.   The gumbo was great, flavorful.  The corn bread was ok.  I did like my drink...ballantyne girl, yum.    Very spacious inside.  Nice atmosphere.  Felt fine with our 3 kids with us.  Service was ok...she disappeared a few times.

FLMxvmDWs3xsXTUtE2xphQ.text: Had an early dinner here with colleagues from work. Easy parking in an upscale area of Charlotte called Balllentyne. Easy parking for this time of day and seated immediately. We did not drink but the dressing on my side salad was some type of balsamic vinegar dressing and excellent. I ordered a grilled Salmon with side vegetables which was excellent and perfectly cooked. We skipped the desserts. The restrooms were clean and tidy.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

7MaN-i844ubV2YbqPmh1AQ.text: We sat outside on a Wednesday evening and overall it was pleasant.  I ordered the chicken and subbed the sides for Mac & cheese and broccoli gratin.  My wife got the pork chop and subbed the sides for truffle fries and the cauliflower brussel sprouts hash.  The sides were better than the entrees.  The chicken and pork chop we're both somewhat dry.  With the hash I thought the cauliflower was the best part, so maybe the mashed cauliflower would have been better.  Truffle fries and Mac and cheese were good.  Probably won't be back.

xt9AotGL1cpFvALYKz5idw.text: My fiance and I wanted to try a new restaurant near us in south Charlotte and found Vine.  We really liked their concept of farm to table and were expecting pretty good food.  The prices were a little high, however if it was truly farm to table food we were willing to pay for the better quality food.  However, that was not what we got.  We ordered a couple of different things to share between the two of us, that way we could taste a couple of different things.  We got Steak Lettuce Wraps, a Margherita flatbread, and Ultimate Grilled Cheese (I love adult grilled cheese sandwiches). The lettuce wraps were ok, nothing special about them, and the same with the flatbread.  However the Grilled cheese was the worst grilled cheese I have eaten at a restaurant.  They made the sandwich out of Texas Toast that you get from the grocery store, which is some of the worse bread you could use for a sandwich.    Nothing blew my mind about this restaurant and I don't believe that it's farm to table food, it would have been much better.  My fiance and I prefer my cooking (which is farm to table cooking) over this place any day.  We will not be returning to this place again.

jfuTzdpbR8-YVYhMeK8zrg.text: We have been here for dinner 2 or 3 times but today we tried brunch. Which was the best idea ever. First the coffee is great. We ordered biscuits and gravy as an app and we were not disappointed. Large pieces of sausage with homemade gravy and homemade biscuits. On point. The service is awesome as well. The main meals we got were steak and eggs with grits and crab cake Benedict with potatos. We were wonderfully surprised . The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare and the grits were cooked perfectly. The crab cake was a real crab cake with no fillers. No fishy taste. Which is rare in charlotte. The hollandaise was prob my favorite part, just like my mothers, homemade and delicious. They poached the eggs perfectly with no break. The potatos were perfect too. Super happy, will return again for the sunday brunch.

nO7V3oKndfgK34yyp296PQ.text: Up from Charleston, Staying at the Ballantyne Hotel. Thought we would give them a try. Great Crab Cakes & Gumbo.

HQs9i3YbfD7yHAeGZ6VZKQ.text: Went for my husband's Christmas party. First time visit and enjoyed our dinner & experience. Best calamari i have ever had. We both had steaks - mine was a little undercooked & could have used a little more salt but still yummy. I enjoyed 3 different martini's. My favorite by far was the Southern Peach!! S'mores was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main course
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Martini

6ehUTWrqv2XrmCzWuJOGtg.text: I've eaten here once before. I am pretty sure I liked it. So I've given it three stars on faith because last nights meal was just not great.  Bleu cheese chips starter was just ok. House salad was soggy. French dip was so salty I couldn't eat it. I am sometimes overly aware of salt but others at the table tried it and also found it inedible.   Our waitress was just decent. She showed bare minimum attention. I didn't bother making a comment on the sandwich to her because I just didn't think she'd care anyway.  My husband really liked his calimari fries appetizer and the shrimp and grits.   Atmosphere is nice enough. We'd probably come back if we were with a group that wanted to. Otherwise we wouldn't venture back of our own volition.

U3tC-NZORBBPfMFzY0QujA.text: A good place to bring your girlfriend to for date night or you can also bring your wife.  The wine selection there is very good not awesome but very good plenty of parking a little high-priced in my opinion for the food but the food is decent.

0OsGJwjo31nsWYDGPBVuBQ.text: My family had visited the vine several times. The food and service is always great but overpriced. Recently 3 of us ordered a salad.  2 with salmon and 1 with chicken. We all had water and our total bill was in the $50 range. That is ridiculous for salads. Plus you do not get any bread or anything to go along with the salad.  We probably will not visit again because we can get great food elsewhere for a better value

dEATlJzzflbx8pfNpn0Yhg.text: Went to Vine "specifically" based on strong Yelp reviews about "crab cakes".  Ordered three appetizers (including crab cakes) and shared two salads in order to get a good sample of Vine's offerings.  Salads were very good.  Crab cakes were "mushy", resembling animal droppings, and WAY TO SALTY to eat...left one on the plate.  Fried green tomatoes were SO OVERLY THICK they were uncooked inside.  Doubt the chef has ever eaten good ones?  Tuna appetizer was overly expensive, and had only a five very small bites of tuna.  I only bring issues such as these to the chef "IF" i think there is hope.  I paid the check including a generous tip for excellent waitress service and left quietly, never to return.

hZGpYTUhRFZ7BwqBbbJ2Gw.text: The wife and I tried Vine American Kitchen on a Friday night around 8pm. There was no wait as many of the tables were empty. The service was very good and we really enjoyed the ambiance. The interior is nicely appointed and feels a bit upscale.   The food was also very good. We started with the cornbread, which is drizzled with honey/sugar and could easily be eaten for dessert. For dinner, I had a flatbread pizza with barbecued chicken and cheddar cheese and she tried the filet mignon with baked potato, both served in good portions. A prior reviewer mentioned the up-charge for the skillet mac and cheese and he was right. We substituted this side for the asparagus that normally comes with the filet. Despite the fact that each side is priced at $5.95 a la carte, we were advised there would be an additional charge of $3 "because the mac and cheese comes in a whole skillet." That simply does not make sense but it was delicious anyway.   The only thing that kept this review from getting five stars was the price of the cocktails. I had two Maker's Manhattans, normally priced between $7 - $10 depending on the restaurant. I was quite disappointed when our bill read $27 for the two drinks. Yikes! Good thing the wife is pregnant and just drinking water these days. I did see that draft beers were around $5 so I'll probably choose beer next time.   We look forward to coming back to Vine in the near future.

J7MZ1goJb6TURlPVCvWadQ.text: A group of ladies and I went out for a social dinner on a wednesday night.  The service was ok, I ordered a gin and tonic tall with extra lime.  I got an anemic "tall" (ounce wise could not have been more than 8oz.) with one lime.  Had to ask for the second one which took a while.   ordered the ribs with the cole slaw and sweet potato fries.  The sides were delicious. The sweet potato fries were a little sweet with the extra sugar on them, but I ate them all!!   The ribs, hmmm.  They were a hair on the tough side and extremely small.  The bones were maybe 2-1/2" long.  Then there was a huge strip of fat along one side of the rack.  Overall, very expensive for just ok food and service.

H-FtYDsAxRhdBtnOyQ8gfg.text: I got some take-out for my lunch and ordered the grilled cheese that comes with tomatoes and a honey mustard sauce. Not a combination I would have chosen but I can't say it was horrible. I haven't returned though and likely won't any time soon. Service was good and the food was ready by the time I arrived, but it just didn't impress me to the point where I had to go and tell my friends about this new place I visited.  Who knows? Maybe I'll wander in on another lunch break, but time will tell.

6yUMT8rUBbJy4JxwzdsHeA.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Breakfast/brunch on Sunday is a gem as kids eat free with a main entree.

xSE_5mR8WfoVYPZVPu_4gw.text: Nice ambiance. Great service. I think his name was Sam. A bit overpriced.   The reason I'm giving them a 3 is because they I went there on New Years Eve for dinner. Me, my girlfriend, and another person we were with all ordered steaks. Mine and my friends came out well done when we ordered medium rare. My girlfriend ordered medium well and got medium rate. They ran out of baked potatoes and brought us mashed potatoes instead. Minor note but still. We had ours sent back and it took close to 10 to 15 minutes to get it back, so everyone was almost done. The manager came back and offered us a free soup or salad but I declined because of the size of my steak. Ultimately, they just forgot about it and we paid full price for below average steaks with little taste, after waiting for close to 15 minutes. I don't foresee us going back there because of it.

BSqgbCHS-ObfyPmaNiCVFA.text: I have been to Vine on a few occasions.  Love the atmosphere and food is great.  Service seems to be inconsistent though.  My date (who came from Charleston, SC) and I went a few weeks ago on a Saturday night and decided to sit at the bar.  That won't happen again. Service was awful. Bartender seemed annoyed that we where even there. Had the personality of a pea.  My date ordered, she got it wrong, perhaps she should have listened.  Not a smile, hi how are you.... I can get a better welcome a chain restaurant.  My favorite was when my date asked for the bill.  She tossed a paper receipt to him in a get out kinda way.  I have been a server for years on and off.  Are you not supposed to place it in a book and pass it to the patron??? We did share the crab cakes which where delicious with 2 sides.  Will go again, but not the bar...

d0RxTOZ8_YdzFZHP1bk1Rw.text: Tasty food! Great service. Love their restaurant week amazing grilled salmon and Mac and cheese!

-RGm-s_VjITKunK829XFPQ.text: My dinner was very good; another in our party was not pleased with his. It was pretty noisy so conversations were difficult other than right next to you. I will go again. The outdoor seating looked nice.

aReE1b42Huj5Jdj4tJSP2g.text: I came here about two years or so ago, and it wasn't nearly as good as it was this time. Like some have mentioned here, the food was overly salty my first visit and I definitely wasn't going to make this a date night with the wife. Skip to today...much better! I had the special, grouper with asparagus on top of couscous. It was all cooked great!

zGH9OddtKavEUpIryqxR8w.text: My wife had the sea bass which was fantastic the food was great and service good considering it was Valentine's Day.

dfit0yHnJH4y89FBfUu4sQ.text: I am afraid I wouldn't get too attached to this place.  In short, the food was quite good but the service was terrible.  I went there this weekend with two other couples.  We coincidentally met up with an even larger group of people in the bar prior to dinner, all of whom also just happened to be there that night.  The place was pretty dead for 8pm on a Saturday night, but yet I still had to wave down our server *for ever drink round* in order to keep the fun going.  I would have estimated that server likely could have gotten 2-3 more rounds out of our group -- a sizable bar order -- had he just been doing a serviceable job that evening.    Then our party moved to a table, still in the bar area so my buddy could watch the Boston Bruins lose game 5, where we apparently had 2 servers both covering us.  But even with extra service on still a sparsely populated restaurant, we had to wait to order appetizers, wait to order dinner, waiting was the theme of the evening I am afraid.    Unfortunate thing is, the food was pretty good.  I had an ahi tuna special and the tuna was indeed fresh and seared very well.  The bruschetta appetizer was great.  I actually liked the thicker-cut bread that wasn't overly crunchy.  My wife greatly enjoyed her salad; the entire table enjoyed every dish that was ordered as a matter of fact.  Everything, that is, except the lousy service.  I would not come back here unless I hear the service greatly improves.  The food was very good, but not so good as to overcome the poor service.  Hopefully I am wrong because I like having more dining options in my area, but unless something changes dramatically I expect this restaurant to have the same fate as its predecessors.

ErQJWHaHi6-sDWvbydpltw.text: Vine is one of our favorite places.  Good wine and local sourced food make it stand out.  Ask for Jeremy.  He is our favorite server!

XRIhbbceUOSupObhEutdyw.text: Jeremy was awesome! He took care of our large group of Kw leadership and made us all happy! He deserves a HUGE high five! GREAT food! Great service.

3ABDoI8CKGXb1MHBbdEuKg.text: We reserved the Barrel Room for a second time for a company event and both times were top notch. Food was great and the service excellent. Special thanks to JC for doing an incredible job!  Thanks

Pgz9-zfGQUUgtj7XHdl8RA.text: Jeremy took great care of us on our first time here. Make sure you try the skillet cookie!  Bruce was great too!

7RupGDx_hsMiNHt-xbH32g.text: Visiting on a work trip. Decided to try Vine and so glad I did. Our server, Jeremy, was phenomenal! He had great recommendations for us that did not disappoint! Great menu, be sure to ask for a Jeremy!

M2v6XuwMr3cUX8u3SYqmPw.text: Comfortable atmosphere and great food.  I highly recommend the chicken salad.  Their sweet potato fries are the best I've had!  Closed Sunday.

S-FOHAltGwM_6lyvlvI7ig.text: Great place to meet for happy hour.   Good food, good, wine, good prices.  We had a large group but Jeremy took very great care of us which made our experience the best!  We will be back!  Vine is a must try.... don't  forget to ask for Jeremy!

yIfu0i1hc5Ydpo5sRNhKkA.text: Vine is nice. I think that the wait staff is what really makes this place. Our waitress was Miranda and she was so knowledgeable and helpful to us in describing the offerings. For me the food was not all that grand, but again we only ordered apps. Next time, I will test the entrees. The overall experience at Vine was very nice.

kIqNzE0iTX1qEk2n4YMSYg.text: We had a wonderful meal, crab cakes and Vine salad were amazing and kiddo loved the Mac and Cheese! Our server made the dining experience even better- personable and he  knew the menu very well! Jeremy was the best!!!

eRi_BBJMKu_hlM2J6GqHHQ.text: Not their night.   Have eaten there before and generally enjoy.  Tonight:  food was cold; service was flat; and restrooms needed service.

r1Q65N9zheWy9AtWdBfoDQ.text: The only reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because of their wine selection. Upon being seated, our server started out strong. We had drinks served and orders taken within 10 minutes of being seated. Our appetizers came out quickly and both the shrimp and calamari were very good. After appetizers, everything went downhill. Our waiter disappeared and only refilled our small water glasses once for the rest of the night. Multiple orders came out very cold. When we finally received warm food, it still wasn't very good. We had to flag down other servers to receive any service. For an average of $25-$30 per dish, you can get much better food and service at another restaurant.

o0Psh4xcKGIYSBR7ByOVmg.text: Met friends for a cocktail and dinner at Vine in Ballantyne. We met at 6pm on a a Friday and the place was surprisingly empty. Cocktails were fresh and well crafted. The service was excellent and food was good too. Being on a diet, I had some specific requests which were happily accommodated. When we left at 8pm, it was still kind of empty. Im puzzled. Did people just forget about Vine? Price point was good, food & service was above average. If you are in Ballantyne, give Vine a try. The flip side is - if we don't support these types of restaurants, will be inundated with more boring chain restaurants.

hgsNSL8-ohx1sSRfrZ6Vgw.text: Our waiter was rude and inattentive. Only filled our waters once after being there almost two hours, and that was only after we complained. He didn't listen to us and when we complained didn't apologize but rather gave excuses. The owner said he would "take care of it" but nothing was done and we never heard from him again. Won't be back.

g-DVmVKR1Wufkgzaq7Qa2g.text: Amazing service from Jeremy our waiter. He made great food recommendations and was very attentive. Definitely coming back!

dpToOT9NioT-UoE5KwzJkQ.text: Vine is a restaurant that I probably would not have chosen, however I was pleasantly pleased with the variety that the menu offered. They were a little more busier than normal but this is to be expected during "Restaurant" week. I'll definitely try them again outside of restaurant week because they have a few items that I really would like to devour! I would definitely recommend Vine to anyone ready to jump out of the normal!

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings! Smokey and full of a Soy Flavor, pretty good!
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tender loin was Better than it looks Very tender and Full of flavor
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cakes,spinach &amp; slaw Hardly No filler!

LeNa9scexaJU95sXweo4Ew.text: had a fantastic lunch here today with a friend. Our experience was awesome. Great salads, service. Ask for Kevin. He was the best!!!!

thQnFczNpDqn4NM3FLrceQ.text: We had an excellent night out with awesome food and service.  The prime rib was excellent and always go for the fried green tomatoes.  Jeremy was our waiter and he was incredibly friendly with great service and a touch of humor thrown in.

OIzsWvRerB1Y7oC8vZnYxQ.text: I came here for a meeting with my job.  My first impression was that this is a very classy, charming restaurant.  They had a conference room set up for us off to the side.  It was really nicely set up and felt extremely comfortable.  The service was great!  The servers were extremely attentive and always checking up on us.  The food was delicious.  I had a steak and it was cooked perfectly.  I would love to come back another time to check it out for dinner or maybe even lunch.

c9sMGSVMh8ne2awVxM89lw.text: I came in with my girlfriend to celebrate a little while back for lunch. We had an amazing server, I can't remember his name, but he was extremely nice and knowledgeable. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was wonderful. We will be back!

zzfm68_mmMOJXF9Y6xFg4Q.text: Food was amazing, especially the crab cakes. Our server Jeremy was friendly and very helpful in selecting the best dishes for our guests. We will definitely be back!

vYY8K20rvTKy8qtP4svX1A.text: The shrimp and grits were amazing along with the Tito martinis.  The waitress was very helpful in selecting drinks.  Definitely a place to go.

JemSnkc_xFk8z-H8Lw2kiw.text: Nothing was notable.  The wine classes were smudged (all of them), the food was marginal to below average.  The waitress raved about the ribs only to then tell us after we ordered that they were out (we had a 6:30 reservation on a Sat) - how does that happen??  Then one order came out wrong.  The shrimp pasta dish didn't taste anything like what the menu described and was pretty weak.  It's really too bad because the ambiance and location is good but the only good thing between the 4 of us was the wine and the company.  I would NOT recommend NOR would I go back.

wsE6zx0i6f3n35yz-WVnWQ.text: Wonderful atmosphere, great customer service, fresh delicious food all for a reasonable price. Who could ask for more. The salmon is fresh not frozen and the salads are always crisp and full of the finest ingredients. This is definitely one of my favorite places to dine or just enjoy drinks by the fireplace.

_pY-lGXsy81_rroWvmNSVA.text: My wife and I visited The Vine for the first time on Saturday. The decor was nice and relaxing. The food was average at best for the price. The menu selections were very basic and not what I was expecting. The menu is basically flatbreads, burgers, sandwiches and two fish dishes. We had the fried green tomatoes for our appetizer. The breading on the tomatoes was too thick and under seasoned.  I ordered the flounder and I asked for no mushrooms and it promptly arrived with tons of mushrooms. The fish was warm and soggy. When our waitress came over to check on us and saw me removing the unwanted item she couldn't leave the table quick enough. My wife had the crake cakes which were very good but they were like a crab imperial.  The dessert was key lime pie, which was good.  The pie had a cream cheese topping as well as whipped cream, but our waitress told us it was only whipped cream.  She was very wrong.  Overall it was below average, probably won't go back when we could spend that money at Aria, Upstream, Osso, etc.  If I wanted 521 type dinner, I would stay closer to the house.

nmuijV8jucTy02kR-jSEpA.text: I had the steak salad and it was absolutely amazing.  I will be back for that dish alone.  The steak is rotisserie style, laid on a bed of spinach with blue cheese, mushrooms and more deliciousness.  In addition, the service was impeccable--the server was very knowledgeable, pleasant and efficient.  The ambiance is such that you want to take your time and enjoy your company and dish! ;)  I can't wait until summertime when they open all the floor to ceiling windows!

-0rau8Ea4LEV-kkXYjK00g.text: This was our first visit.  We were warmly greeted, quickly seated and promptly served by our waitress.  A nice atmosphere.  We both wound up ordering crab cakes.  Short answer - they were darn tasty and a good portion size.  The fries were above average and the side slaw was very good, fresh.  A good date night place.  We will come again and go deeper on the menu.

md3kKh-GGOMFaB4iTS5XAQ.text: I am giving Vine two stars because the atmosphere was great and the food, once we received it was good. We had a reservation for Mother's Day so we expected it to be busy and a little slower. What we experienced was terrible service and a restaurant that was completely unprepared. We started out good and ordered drinks and an appetizer for the table. Some drinks arrived but we were told they were out of the appetizer. We then ordered our food and noticed my parents never received their water. We asked for their water and then after a reasonable amount a time a server came out and put a plate in front of my mother. It was what she ordered. Another server then came a took it away giving it to the table next to us because that is where it was supposed to go. 30 minutes after we ordered our food had not yet arrived. The manager came over and apologized and suggested we order some desserts on the house. The server and manager must not have communicated well because he then came and told us lunch was on them. He was wrong. Our food finally arrived and it was good. We had to ask for several missing items that were never brought out. My husbands water glass was never refilled so he started drinking mine. We waited a long time for them to finally bring us dessert menus. We ordered three desserts for our group of 7 and asked for the check since we were tired of waiting. The server finally noticed my husband needed water and said he would bring it. He never did. Twenty minutes later our server reappeared to tell us they were out of one of the desserts. We said we didn't need any dessert and just wanted the check. It arrived with desserts on the bill as well as three extra beverages that we did not order. The check was finally fixed and we were given two desserts to go for our trouble. I hardly think it was compensation. Lunch took us over two hours. Management should have been more proactive and apologetic.

A07O_-uEj-QwBrKVmYl68g.text: All I can say is WOW! The Vine had me at first bite. I rarely give 5 star reviews but this place didn't just earn it they set the bar for it. I had the slow cooked ribs which needless to say were nothing short of amazing. The wait staff was very attentive and never had to ask for anything which is highly unusual as I drink a lot of water. Wine list is huge and my girlfriend tried something new as per our waiters suggestion. My girlfriend said she loved which she never tries anything new so that surprised me. Fireplace was awesome and romantic great place to take a date. Definitely will be back. Next time I have to try the chefs cookies I saw it at another persons table and I was mad at myself that I get it.

NlpfXa4vtzfWhg6Lkq1P2Q.text: We went for restaurant week. So, the restaurant was very busy. Despite this, the service was perfect and the food was very good. We all had the filet which was cooked perfectly and very tender. Some of the best asparagus I've ever had. Midway through our meal, a server brought us a plate of fried green tomatoes that were accidentally made. We really appreciate the fact that the restaurant attempts to control waste in this way. The food took a while to get to us, which can be attributed to the chaos of restaurant week, but all in all a great experience.

RIHYHC6QUf_q3kJtEHfCHw.text: Vine is a solid addition to the Ballantyne dining scene. Each of the 3 times that I've been I have found it a welcoming and very delicious oasis. From the warm yet open atmosphere, to the very attentive staff, to the fresh and well prepared appetizers and entrees, to a great wine list of known and new labels -- this foodie has a new favorite dining destination. Long live Vine!

aORFkVOMSPoqFvHsIcktHA.text: Food and service very inconsistent.  Last time we were here the owner was in and everything was great - food had great balance and you could actually taste each ingredient.  This time, not so much - ribs were very spicy but not a lot of taste other than that...  Food was cold, slow service.

Nr51XSIQQBprTHyA8gPrbw.text: Went last night with family.      My niece wanted a cool martini because she just turned 21. No menu for drinks.  Seriously?  The server told us in was in the bartenders head.   Lol.  I have been I Foodservice for 20 years and that is not the best approach to get your guest check average up.   If you want to keep up with 131 main. Spend 20 minutes and create a cool drink menu.      Food was average.  Banana cream pie. Very disappointing it should be called coconut cream pie with a slice of banana.   Again.  131 main does it better.      There stop the food was average.  Nothing makes them stand out above anything else in the Ballantyne area.

OzYJ93TbGHwdkYRuov-Hsg.text: We tried Vine the first week it opened for lunch, and it was good.  So, we decided to go there and try if for dinner tonight.   Very busy, which was an initial good sign.   Unfortunately, that was one of the few good signs for the evening. - The waiter started by asking us if we had been there before, and when we said we had, he said it was "unusual to have repeat visitors." - 2 of us ordered filet medium, which came out well done.   I give the manager credit for offering to redo the steaks, but since the flavor was still good, we decided to keep them versus waiting for new steaks.  One of the baked potatoes was lukewarm, so we sent it back.   The potato they brought back was exactly the same.   As for the steaks relative to the price, they were small, thin filets for the price....$29 for the entree. - I ordered the jambalaya.   It was average, with the prominent flavor being salt. - To make up for the overdone steaks, they did offer us a free desert.   Nice gesture, but for a new restaurant, I would suggest they offer a gift certificate and ask us to come back and give them another chance, plus a comp for at least one of the meals. - When the waiter went through the dessert options, he said that the key lime pie was "standard, nothing fancy".   - the wine list was good, with a wide selection and price points.   We decided to order a Washington State wine that was very good.    In summary, there are many choices in the south Charlotte area that have better food at a lower price point.   Vine American Kitchen may end up being a good after work scene, but they have some work to do in order to compete with the other food options in the area.

0KZfMDpNraiRWrUjD2z3vg.text: Have been to Vine a few times now since it has opened.  It is quickly gaining a reputation as a hot spot to be and it will be interesting to see if they can hang on to that after they have been open a little longer.  I love the fireplace room where you can go and lounge and have a cocktail, or even book for a company event.  The menu to me is great as it has something for everyone.  Vine has a high class atmosphere, where you can order a few drinks, filet mignon or fish, and spend 100 dollars, or you can order an amazing burger or a chicken sandwhich and have a couple of beers for 20 dollars.  The bar has TV's positioned so that no matter where you are sitting you will be able to view any even that is currently on.  I definitely enjoy the food here, the drinks are a tad pricy(makers mark on the rocks $10), but the atmosphere is easily one of the top in the area.  The outdoor patio is great with fire pits that you can sit around.  It can get a little noisy when it is crowded, and lately happy hour has been very crowded.  The bar could use a little more space between the dining side wall and the bar, as when it is crowded the wait staff will need the space to get by, but usually that is not too much of a problem.  Overall I view Vine as a spot I will be visiting regularly in Ballantyne as the atmosphere is hard to match and the food is excellent.

VD4UZXWrnQyWs_rkjpv8vA.text: I eat here at minimum once a week for lunch. Their staff is attentive and the food is fantastic. The coleslaw is the absolute best I have ever eaten, nothing quite compares to it. I recommend the napa salad or the grilled cheese for lunch, with the slaw, but of course.

d5edWsn1ZqBhto74lo26SQ.text: Went here for dinner last night with 1 other couple. Went early to enjoy a glass of wine at the bar- very nice,relaxed atmosphere. The young lady that was bar tending,not real friendly but got the job done. We were only asked by another bartender if we wanted another glass, but at that time we were heading to our table. Our server, Alena was wonderful! Friendly, helpful, and entertaining! She was really good about checking back with us, kept our glasses full, and opens a bottle of wine very smoothly.  We started with the blue cheese chips that were very good! I had the ribs, nicely done. Husband had the prime rib which was the special, that was also good & cooked perfectly. Friends had the chicken pasta & a burger. Plates were cleaned!  Even though we were stuffed we had to go for dessert as well. We ordered both the butterscotch chocolate pie & the cherry bread pudding with ice cream. Yummy! I also like that management was out front,checking on tables, &stopping by to see how we were enjoying our meal. More places need to be doing that! We'll be back.

stAU2b1mgQR9HXdWlDfTDg.text: I went to dinner on New Year's Eve. At first I was a bit put off by having to give my credit card number to make a reservation...pretty ridiculous to be charged for cancelling a reservation. A minor setback, but if you're making a reservation for a large party be sure you show up. The inside is exactly like 131 Main or Firebirds; dark, open, comfortable and slightly loud. Both the wine menu and the food menu is of decent size and offers a decent amount of options. The food was excellent though, but a little pricey for the amount you got. Most of the entrees I would have thought were $5-$10 overpriced, appetizers $2-$4 overpriced. No bread was given on the table which also surprised me. All in all it was very good food, nice atmosphere, average service but just a little overpriced. Dinner for two with wine will cost you about $85-$90 before tip.

6AJuvoYEznbGHdZCzyo4aQ.text: Decent new restaurant, but a lot could be improved. I had the Vine salad with salmon, which was really good. But rather small for an entree salad. Especially since there was no bread served with the meal, I left still a bit hungry. And the desert I ordered, the butterscotch chocolate chip pie, was a real disappointment. It seemed as if it weren't cooked enough, sort of raw cookie dough in the middle. And what are they thinking, serving it COLD with no ice cream?? Fail on the dessert. But the tasty salad will bring me back. Service was ok.

urrtkjPnImMdDNueJn15Rg.text: Lunch was good - the chefs special was a pulled pork sandwich - very good. Cole slaw is amazing. French dip isn't worth it.

utGj7cUh9s4o4igtNhpuBw.text: When we got there at noon and the parking lot was pretty much empty, we should have known this wasn't going to be a good experience.  Our waiter was extremely irritating and bothersome while waiting for us to decide what to order.   I guess because they weren't busy, he had nothing better to do but to hassle us.    My friend and I both ordered the French dip.    It arrived about 5 mins later - which was a surprise.   I took off the top of the bun to remove some of the beef and the meat was freezing cold - practically had ice crystals on it.    We sent them back and were told they would make new ones and a man, that I assume was the manager, came by and apologized.    About another 5 mins went by and the waiter brought new French dips.  This time they were barely warm - I have NEVER been served a COLD  French Dip.   The waiter and the manager came by and asked if it was better.    I told them "not really" but just nevermind.    The constant interruptions were really getting on our nerves and by this point, we just wanted to be left alone.   The waiter came back again and said the "chef" said it was barely warm because if he warmed it any longer the beef would be well done.      I told him I WANTED it well done but just nevermind - it was fine.   again - I was tired of talking about it.    Then one of them came by AGAIN and said next time I order the French Dip, just to let them know I wanted it well done.   I wanted to say - "there won't be a next time!!!!!"      I also think they should tell people up front when they order the French Dip, "the chef likes to leave the beef raw and freezing cold - is that ok? or would I prefer it actually warm and cooked?"   The only good part of the lunch was that they cut the bill 50%.     My friend and I agreed that we won't be going back there!

_ynpgiIKWLM4MSJ7Hs9kNg.text: Waiter was knowledgeable about the menu items and wine list. Great service. The crab cakes are great (mostly crab) and the flounder special was delicious. Will definitely dine here again when I'm in town.

mr30CR61bYSbOcGxvO10JA.text: Tried several dishes here, the rib-eye is the best if what I had.  Seems over priced, but good for a business dinner.  Don't think I would spend my own money here.

6ub6uTFARyscRBzT8-005Q.text: I've eaten at the Vine several times and it gets better and better. Mixed drinks are good and the menu is varied. I've pretty much tasted everything. I have yet to dislike anything and will keep going back. The service has been excellent. One wait- staff person in particular treats us like we're special...ask for Dalinda. The Blue Cheese Chips and Crab Cakes are wonderful. The Jambalaya is to die for.  Food is fresh, never frozen and plentiful. Beautiful & comfortable decor.

G-P9F4TUXoyhitm2dStu-w.text: Excellent place. Great vibe and great food! For appetizers we had the fried green tomatoes, corn bread and blue cheese chips. All were excellent. My favorite was definitely the corn bread. For the entree I had the crab cake. I was NOT expecting it to be lump crab meat so it was a pleasant surprise. You will not be disappointed!

nCFyw_qnPuY60S9AFf5pfw.text: Let me start by saying that I am from Maryland and love Vine's crab cakes. I enjoy the Vine salad and generally like the food there very much. The poor service we received tonight negated any enjoyment we received from the food. When I spend that kind of money on food and drink, I expect adequate (not even stellar) service. It took forever for our initial drink order to arrive and then I had to summon the waiter after an excessive wait to place an order for food. We felt ignored the entire time we were there. Clearly there was a problem somewhere - a shortage of wait staff and perhaps also in the kitchen. I sat there and watched our waiter engage with other patrons, make small talk and check on them while we sat there waiting. It did appear that most customers were waiting a long time for their food and drinks. They could most definitely have done more to compensate for this - give people some bread - something! I will say that my husband's drink was incredibly weak and my cranberry margarita was almost undrinkable (and I like my drinks strong and sour!).
