Maybe if someone had made me feel like they cared about me as a customer, I would have given them a pass this time and not be writing this review. I feel like I just flushed over $100 down the toilet. After this, I don't know if I'll be back or not.

jGu-dVW78i5O_9ReZy5SIg.text: Great place for groups, couples, and friends. The specials and other menu options are great. Try the cornbread (yum!). They have a FULL/COMPLETE alcoholic beverage list (wine, champagne, beers, mixed drinks).

5De_OOMOj0vcOkKyTud_1w.text: Went a few weeks ago, ordered the house special:  rainbow trout with haricot verts and a saffron rice. The rice arrived undercooked but the server was exceptional in offering alternatives. However, the manager made a less than cursory stop by the table and had no interest in the fact that a side item was not cooked properly, nor did she even offer an apology. Kudos to the wait staff for doing an acceptable job, however I will not be returning for this overpriced and pre-packaged food item menu.

BYd0A2B_E9jBwMB-gAugCA.text: Some girlfriends and I came for restaurant week and were quite pleased with our overall experience. The service was excellent and the ambiance was very quiet and relaxing. The food was good -- not out-of-this world -- but definitely a good value for what we paid. Our $30 Queen's Feast meals included a glass of wine/craft beer, a salad, entree, and dessert. I had the house chardonnay. It wasn't very dry, an easy drinker. I chose the Vine salad and felt like it could've used a little bit more in the topping department. The variety of toppings was good, but it was sparse and I had leftover greens. Next, I ordered the baked crab cakes with cole slaw and fries. I found the crab cakes to be tasty, just wished there was a tad more sauce. The cole slaw was refreshing, but there was an herb/spice in it that's just not for me. The fries were hot and fresh, but could've used a little more seasoning. The cheesecake was delicious. Overall, it was a great experience and meal. I'm just nit-picking for the food snobs out there. ;)

nYRqmwIgFkMT_eZWGvR0fA.text: Love the atmosphere. Very cozy!  I've been here for lunch with friends in the 'glass' room which was so nice and it cuts down on noise and let's you enjoy the time with your friends. The food at lunch was nice and now I'm here for dinner. The wait was suppose to be a while since its restaurant week and a Saturday night but we were able to find a table in the beautiful indoor sitting area next to the fireplace. I love this restaurant. Will keep you posted in tonight's dinner!

UCdMSlDTDEqTNbH0BgXwSQ.text: Dinner on Thur night around 6 pm. First time visit. Busy bar crowd with warm interior, mostly booths, wood and leather.  Kind of reminds me of a Houston's.  Overall good service, food arrived very quickly...are they looking for more table turns?  But server didn't rush us, mgr stopped to see if things were good.  Food was good, had roast beef wife had the pasta.    One criticism is their wine is overpriced IMOP. I found bottle prices to be 2 1/2 - 3 times normal retail. And even though it was 1/2 price wine night it was not a good value.  Urge management to consider a more reasonable pricing plan.    Would recommend and will return.  Good addition to the area.

ue8w_d7gPO8uMF7bSwoA0A.text: I went to Vine Restaurant for a meeting with a group of friends.  Immediately I was impressed with the decor of the restaurant. I loved the way you could see the chef cooking the food from your table and the "Barrel Room" my group had which is a private room inside the restaurant was nice and cozy. instead of solid walls most of the room was surrounded by glass but you had the option to make it more private by closing the curtain. The food was also phenomenal! Our group had an opportunity to try several appetizers and wine.  My favorites are the Southwestern Guacamole which was chunky and tasty. The New Orleans BBQ Shrimp was fantastic the sauce that is placed over it is amazing. The Maytag blue cheese chips and  fried green tomatoes were great as well. The Vine also has a great wine selection. The food and the private room we had were amazing but none of this would have been possible without the server we had, her name is Alex and her service was on point from start to finish. She consistently checked on our group and had a pleasant demeanor and was very knowledgeable if we had questions about the menu. She also made sure that our glasses were always full and kept our group's table very organized. I was very pleased with the service Alex provided along with the food that was served. Let's just say that I'll be back to this place very soon! P.S. Thanks again Alex for making our experience at Vine memorable!

Z6bcZnO24gi-hpiA0NMqCg.text: This was our first visit since it opened and we were suitably impressed with the service and the food. Our waiter was efficient but not overbearing. Chris had a New Year's day special of scallops, collards and black-eyed peas, the traditional good-luck meal in the South.  I had a turkey burger and sweet potato fries. One of the tastiest turkey burgers I've had. A large space with many booths and a spacious bar area as well. We'll be back.

RTtkuu_JojcG7y6ygFYOKA.text: This was an awful experience. We had to wait at least 15 minutes just to be approached once seated. We didn't have enough silverware, or plates, for the table. As for the appetizers, the calamari wasn't cooked, and our cornbread arrived 20 minutes later. The entrees were decent. However, they were out of their coconut cake, what they are seemingly famous for and frankly one of the main reasons we went. We won't be returning.

lMu2_77ymOVrcdeQtEjZAA.text: Love the VINE! Warm and inviting atmosphere and great location! I have been 3 times for lunch and once for dinner! Great service - fantastic food and I look forward to going again! I have enjoyed the Ballantyne Chicken Sandwich and the sweet potato fries are perfection! The salmon with asparagus was wonderful. My husband loves the Gumbo and Southwestern Guacamole appetizer. Their twist on the Southern Style Jalapeno Cornbread is genius! Enjoyed a yummy Lemon Drop Martini and am impressed by the wine by the glass options! I find the prices to be reasonable and the food flavorful and unique. Can't wait to visit again!

MUSPT3zy5hbf5OxVxy0iGQ.text: I was in Charlotte for two days and this was a random find but a fantastic find.  When we walked In we were told by the friendly hostess that there  was a 25 minute wait so we decided to go grab a drink at the bar. When we noticed there were seats at the bar right away we decided to just sit and have dinner at the bar.  We found two seats facing the whole restaurant which was spacious as well as great for people watching :).  Our bartenders greeted us quickly and were very attentive our whole stay.  We started with the crab cake appetizer which was delicious. All lump crab no filler.  Not enough for a meal but an excellent starter. We ordered the blackened shrimp salad with no bacon and dressing on the side.   It was very flavorful with its jalapeno buttermilk ranch dressing.  I do prefer the shrimp to be cooked a little more but it was still quite tasty with the egg, avocado and blue cheese. We also got the blackened salmon sandwich with fries. The salmon was topped with fried onions which were tasty and was cooked and seasoned perfectly. During our dinner two managers came by to see how everything was going which is always nice.  Our dinner was great if we lived in the area we would frequent Vine as regulars.

j4NN7duAbYVpzJObxKZgLw.text: Went to Vine when we stayed at the Ballantyne hotel.  Food was excellent and did not have any complaints.

2wd-cecDSNQBuspQNLTz3w.text: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!! Just finished my dinner ordered for take out.  It was good...not great, but I normally wouldn't complain.  Here's the problem.  Ordered on the phone at 5:59pm and was told it would be ready in ~20 minutes.  Having severe pelvic pain in the last weeks of my pregnancy and a small infant already really didn't want to have to wait.  We took our time and arrived to pick up our food at 6:27.  My husband went in and found nothing ready behind the bar.  We waited for over 20 minutes as the order was slowly put together.  Was it ever made ahead of time?  Who knows. We drive away and not 3 minutes down the road I get a phone call...  apparently my husband was informed he was supposed to wait because the chicken was not yet ready on the salad - he still says he was not told such a thing.  We turn the car around and the whole time the manager refuses to apologize or claim any wrong doing whatsoever.  He says that they had to re-grill the chicken 3 times because it kept drying out waiting in the window for us.  Even if this is True, it takes 8 minutes to grill a chicken breast - confirmed by the manager himself - even if they grilled it when he arrived at the restaurant at 6:27 it would have been ready by 6:35.  Not 6:55 when I eventually walked away with the food.  The manager insisted this was quality control and literally was chasing me out of the restaurant claiming this and NOT APOLOGIZING until I turned around and asked him to stop because I didn't want to curse. My favorite part....I get home open the containers of food to eat and find my rainbow trout is totally dried out.  Great job on that quality control!!  $46 later - what  great experience.  Thanks Vine American Kitchen, I'll surely be back for more.

1GIHFb3yM9e0YucMw3HyJg.text: The service was fanatastic!  Nice atmosphere!  The meal would have been perfect except my crab cakes were way too salty!  Texture and flavor was great- just way too salty!

V8qfTBA_KTSTYlLcR2E5Qw.text: I met my roommates for dinner and wine here on Friday night. Vine had a very warm and cozy atmosphere with a huge wrap around bar area, friendly staff and GREAT food. The manager, Joe, was super nice and walked around greeting customers the entire time we were there. I will definitely be returning for the blackened shrimp chopped salad and affordable wine selection.

7cCs6wQrnC4EcgBxl2Kr7g.text: Went fior a date with my wife swordfish was cookec perfect and the mashed potoes wete seasoned pefect.  I had the ribeye ordred med. rare half of it medium well and half cooked med rare.  For dessert the coconut cake was great to split and do not order for one serving portion it is huge.  Good food ok service good for a date night not fine dining.

rY0KUuOBQ0VpAsrtLfXB6A.text: OMG I'm stuffed. The food and the people make this place a "Must Go!".   Our server, Jeremy made us feel like we had the entire restaurant to ourselves, catering to our every need with great energy and a wonderful sense of humor.  His food recommendations were spot on...particularly down to the crab cake that I (formerly from the Maryland area) questioned with every sense of my being. But alas, Jeremy was right... the crab cake was awesome!!  So awesome in fact, I ordered a second one to keep for lunch tomorrow, wishing I had room to eat it now. I will be back.

unBkc3E0JZRH5bmaiHojUA.text: Great place for lunch. Had the burger and it was great. Also have an awesome cornbread appetizer. Try it. You will go back.

9x7mj0VrFWS25YQ0xsAQLw.text: Visited here last Saturday (5/10/18) night for my daughter's college graduation.  Walked in at 7:30 needing a table for 12 (someone in our group thought we had reservations, but they were not expecting us - not sure what happened there, could have easily been our fault).  Nevertheless, they were able to accommodate us and we proceeded to enjoy a good meal with very good service.    The special of the day was seafood pasta, but at 7:30, only two servings were left which seemed a bit odd, but we took both and they were enjoyed.  The pork chop looked very good, but both people who had it said it was "just OK", so not sure what happened there.  I had the Gumbo, which again, was "OK".  The other pasta dishes were enjoyed - certainly didn't see much food left over that's for sure.  My comment at the time was I've been to New Orleans too much of late to order Gumbo elsewhere.  Service, again, was really good - not exactly who the main server was as many approached and helped with our tabled, but for a large group they did a very nice job. Their bar did a really job - serving some unusual cocktail specials.   Overall, fairly reasonably priced, good food, very good atmosphere and a warm friendly staff.  I would go back.

NRQS7XC9kiy37PzEHrSiqQ.text: My husband I went here for our Anniversary. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The food was great. Our server Marcus made our experience very memorable.  Although the restaurant was very busy he was very attentive, energetic, & made our special night complete. Quality service is hard to come by these days and our server  Marcus was refreshingly upbeat and genuinely interested in our needs and happiness. We will be back.

6xEzwCyuoXuskyOUmsnRPw.text: I want to say up front, I have no complaints. None, nada, zilch. My family was there last night celebrating my mom's 89th birthday. God bless her. (She would kill me if she knew I called out her birthday). 11 in our party. Everything worked like clockwork. Shout out to Jeremy our waiter who tended to our needs with tremendous professionalism. Great job Jeremy!! Also shout out to the sous chefs and chef! The food at Vine was great! I would come again and I recommend them.

xbqgjsPkvQ8LnV88xOk_JA.text: It's time to update my reviews since I've been here several times since my last review. I've sat in the bar area and have always had great service. They offer a really good happy hour special. Lots of small bites or appetizers for cheap as well as $6 drinks.   I still love their calamari. It's tender and not too bready. Their guacomole is very good. I've also tried their flat bread pizzas. They are huge and not too soggy. Their truffle fries are amazing and you get a large portion for what it's worth.   Overall, this is a great place to wind down and have good drinks and snacks!

iyrPp9002kVm9lIWRJJeVQ.text: Appetizer came,... cold.   Replaced it with another,... you guessed it, ... cold again.    Ordered ribs which were good but not on the hot side either.  The hand towel was hotter.  Food tasted ok but priced on the high side.    Lights were flicking so severely had to ask several times for them to do something about it.  Others had complained as well but i guess manager saw nothing wrong until people spoke up.  At best a MEH.

RArciFoR7heL06Bwp5puZA.text: My husband and I have been married for 2 months. Yay us!! Aside from our AMAZING Honeymoon, this was our First date night. My husband...who's dined here before, was excited to bring me here. He loves the food!   I normally make reservations on Open Table. Unfortunately, Vine wasn't listed on the app. Thanks to Yelp, I was able to find a table.   We arrive around 6:30, the hostess seated us right away. I noticed the booths have a high back, giving each table a more intimate setting. Our waitress was very informative about the menu and specials.  I definitely appreciate the staff here! Several managers and other waitstaff attended to our needs......can you say "Team work". We were seated next to the wine cellar refrigerators, which were illuminated on green lighting.  Food: This is the best part  We started with the Calamari with banana peppers. I ordered a glass of The Biltmore Estate Sauvignon Blanc!! I Highly recommend this to anyone!!!! My entree, I ordered The Blackened Shrimp Salad with a side of Truffle Fries! My husband ordered the Ultimate Grilled Cheese with a bowl of Tomato Bisque and Side salad. Dessert? Cupid Kiss Cocktail and Banana Bread Pudding!! Everything was Delicious! Cooked to perfection!!   This was the perfect Date night for us!! I loved every moment!!! Thank you to everyone at Vine American Kitchen! You guys made our evening sparkle! I definitely look forward to coming here again soon! Hopefully for brunch with my girlfriends! Or maybe even happy hour. But I'm not sure if that's something they offer. Either way, I look forward to another great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamari

2SgPjcS3xGT7oPx3Q7my9Q.text: Awesome!!! and Jeremy was the best waiter ever!!! The crab cakes were to die for! I would highly recommend this! We had such a fun girls night here!

WrUpEf_2VFFBwv2dmbXoTQ.text: I love this place they have the absolute Best Tomato basil soup ever! My son always loves their burgers. Great service as well.

Dt2QHWAxhKkzcMY-eL5Cuw.text: Jeremy made my 1st visit here great! He was our server last night and did a phenomenal job giving suggestions. He was always attentive and made sure our food was perfect! Ask for him when you go!

v3766eD4y7EavGMbQ0KLKw.text: Jeremy is the best server, request to sit in his section! I love the crab cake, it is the best I have ever had! I highly recommend this place!

Wb4VMll9A8nIizqgxNOOZA.text: I'm really not impressed. Are here tonight and the meal itself was not hot, warm at best. For $30 for a center cut steak I would expect better food. Unfortunately the worst part of dining out is paying the bill - it seems like you sit forever waiting for the waiter to come to take your money. That's exactly what happened tonight. Ronald walked by numerous times and oblivious to our need to pay and leave. For this and the outrageous prices I won't be back. I'll go to Firebirds where I get a much better selection of steaks and better prices.

A8vwM91YCx2QunY6w4yAXQ.text: I really enjoyed the happy hour menu which included bar bites from $1.95 to $4.95. Came with a group of 12 and we order just about 2 or 3 of everything on the happy hour menu. We saved a ton and had more fun ordering cocktails.

1ROdzCRWt1apQj1u-R6YLw.text: So disappointing, management disjointed, food is skimpy and mediocre, servers are scattered throughout restaurant and do not provide any continuity. We have frequented this restaurant for 2 years and will not be back until they get their act together. Absolutely a fail - do not waste your time or money.

p6WXYePbvKA_PQnpl2xOUw.text: When you wait for more than 20min for your drink then almost 45 for your appetizer you decide to wait it out and see just how badly things can go. I think we frightened our waiter or perhaps this is his first job serving tables. Either way he sucked. The salad was not dressed just lettuce on a plate. The entrees tasted wonderful it just took a very very long time to get them. I had jambalaya and he had the crab cakes. Oh and they don't use a corn meal batter for the fried green tomatoes. (Yuck)

fIPVIs31_a5jFP3TPHm5zA.text: This place must stay open simply because of the location. Table of 6 for a work dinner and 5 of us didn't enjoy our food. Everything was just so mediocre and had no flavor. One steak was still cold, the others just bland. Sides were underwhelming. Just a so so dinner that was expensive. This is my third time here with similar experience - won't be back

Vfc_lgVe18jVgTyip2bpqQ.text: We really enjoyed Vine for Valentine's Day dinner. This was our first time there and we'll be back.  Caitlin was our waitress and did a fantastic job. She presented the special Valentine's Day menu to us and walked us through the drink options. Since it was our first visit, I asked her about some of the fan favorites or top picks on the menu.  We had a flatbread as an appetizer that was hot and delicious. I had the Jumbo Lump Crabcakes (recommended by Caitlin) and my wife had Cajun Jumbalaya. The crab cakes were phenomenal. They had just enough breading to keep them together, but not enough to make them heavy. The slaw that came with them was very light, clean, and fresh tasting. My wife said the Jumbalaya was very good and tasty. She brought half of it home, it was decent size portion.  The overall menu offers a wide variety for every taste or preference. The drink menu is also strong with plenty wine, beer, and cocktail options if that is something you enjoy.  We sat right outside the open kitchen, so it was a bit noisey, but definitely not too bad.

qI50-Y_OjukKZXj9vZhKVw.text: Very beutiful place wiht great menu, especial the crab cakes and worderful service!!!

mgCkiC1G3Igp2krd48_CHg.text: Dinner was excellent! Jeremy from W.V. He recommended the Crab crake app &  filet and jambalaya. It was exquisite. Please go to Vine and request my man Jeremy.

SQEsboPxYXyunEVcpDrzbw.text: Loved this place! I wasn't feeling great--tired and cranky.  Ordered the roasted chicken, had zero hour es for this being anything but edible and it came and really rocked it!! Rosemary and basil seasonings and my side of greens were scrumptious!! Will be back for sure!

qmNBIj6VwRutL6uz2QJnMw.text: Good overall experience but nothing exceptional.  I had the crab cakes and they were well prepared and moist, came with a small salad on the plate and french fries which I would have rather swapped out for something healthier.  Service was good/average and pricing was fair. Just another chain-type of dining experience that Charlotte unfortunately has way too much of. I'd recommend Vine American but don't expect a dining experience, just good food.

tjuY9CJmC64M_kAuQIBQrQ.text: Food was good. Service below average. Ate at the rounders near the bar and just never received much attention.  I really want this restaurant to succeed, so will keep trying. I bring business clients and visitors to the restaurant. Please improve service as this is not the first time that it was below expectations.

1MD7wj1RQyhJSiGC76Pstg.text: Delicious food!  Nice Atmosphere, very good service!  Will go back.

pLqYsgmPmPhr0arHOd1i1w.text: This restaurant has a great atmosphere, perfect for date night or a night out with the family or friends. They have a good sized bar, though I must say, they could work on pouring better drinks. (The Lemondrop Martini tasted like pure syrup and a Baby Guiness shot didn't even fill up 1/4 of the shot glass and was double the price compared to other bars in the area). The service is pretty good, however one evening when they had a packed house, the service was horrible but I will not blame a whole restaurant on one waitress. The food is good, nothing spectacular, but you will not be disappointed. Oh and very good prices! Can't beat that. Would be a great location to host a private event in one of their private rooms.

O15ak6Vk_oaGz8Qi6U_lhQ.text: This is such a great restaurant a very nice atmosphere delicious food and service is great we are just visiting Charlotte and we are happy we ate here

4HTrV9WWPmu_279Euvupmw.text: Very nice restaurant.  Went for a quick business day lunch.  Server was attentive and informative.  A lot of options for lunch, at varying price points.  The interior reminds me of 131 Main, not too far away.  I had the crab cakes lunch.  Crab cakes were excellent - good chunks of crab meat, cooked perfectly.  They were a little on the small side, but it was adequate for lunch.  The Napa slaw was very good, but there was a huge portion of that on the plate.  I opted to upgrade my side to the skillet mac & cheese.  This was very tasty, but the up-charge was $4, which I thought was a little steep for that (the fries that come with the lunch are listed at $3.95 as a side item, the mac & cheese was $5.95, the up-charge should be $2 at most, right?).  I finished the lunch with the coconut cupcake.  I am very wary of coconut desserts as they tend to be overly sweet.  Not the case here, this coconut cupcake was perfect - the "cake" part was more like a shortcake than a cupcake.  The icing was a creamy toasted coconut, just sweet enough.  Perfection.  While I didn't have any drinks for lunch, I noticed that their wine selection and "by the glass" selections were excellent.

Lu8o7OD4bISgtFfduiXWZw.text: Great anniversary dinner at Vine tonite.  No wait to get seated.  Very attentive service.  I had the Jambalaya my bride of 26 years had the crab cakes & she loved it too..,  Antonella great service & Aaron GM very sooo attentive.    Best restaurant in Ballantyne.  Phil

5QvbDFOOmqVhzY6hNvezYQ.text: We love Vine!!  We come here at least once a week!  Brittany is fantastic!  Ask for her!  The food is fantastic and very reasonably priced for the quality.  I highly recommend Sunday brunch and your kids eat for free!  It's also great for business meetings.  They have a private wine room that seats 8. Try Vine! You'll love it!

MX-heLlY15uU3-vn-_Q2Ug.text: Great service. Delicious pear salad. Pleasant atmosphere. Lunch was reasonable. Will definitely go back!!

bJQxPfQKQ3Iw1Us-aGlZ1g.text: Unbelievable selection of draft beer and and a roaring fire were perfect for a cold night. Appetizers were enough for a meal and the Crab Cakes were moist and loaded with lump crab.  Great presentation and friendly staff I will definitely be back

WRDKeEZYUjLDZa_L62JxMg.text: We've been going here since it opened.  Although we've had some ups and downs, the food is always delicious.  In fact, the Jambalaya is amazing.  Their grilled cheese sandwich is masterful and the fact that they have this great bar right by the outdoors (which in the summer they open up) makes the environment a lot of fun.  To top it off, the butterscotch chocolate chip pie is the perfect ending to the perfect night, as long as they heat it hot enough.  A few times it hasn't been.  But they're always willing to take it back and correct it.  Another great mention is the wine list is very fair in prices with a tremendous selections.

vy3h2vk5EAJc94EXPHU_tQ.text: Don't be put off by the name if you are not a wine fan -- there is plenty to drink.  Went there for lunch and was very impressed by the efficient and friendly staff as well as good food.

PgsSDn2-o1tSqTLXiDI_5g.text: My fiance and I had our wedding rehearsal dinner at Vine. The space accommodated about 50 guests, and it was beautifully appointed. The food was delicious and the service was top notch. Everyone enjoyed themselves and the food at Vine. I would highly recommend Vine American Kitchen.

Uc9jcqb1E2P5f4fG73GYOQ.text: I have been here twice since they opened, and they would have gotten 5 stars, which I never give, however, there is one aspect that they need some major improvement on.  Lets start with the good stuff: -the building itself is very attractive from the outside, and only gets better when you go in.  It is warm and inviting, rustic and modern, all at the same time.  Mostly all booths, which is awesome, because everyone always wants a booth.  They have a large room up front with a fireplace and some couches and chairs, but not sure exactly what the purpose of that room is, and they also have a private dining room as well, and a great bar area. -the servers are awesome!  Knowledgeable, friendly, professional, nicely dressed, and very attentive. -the food is incredible!   American basics done extremely well.  The flatbreads, cornbread, burgers, chicken pasta....all five stars!   Huge variety of beer and wine, and the desserts make your mouth water just looking at them! -prices are very reasonable for the freshness and quality you get.  Now, for the bad news, and an issue that could bring the entire place down if they don't correct it soon......the hostesses and greeting.  Last Saturday night I called at 11am to make a reservation for restaurant week.  The girl told me that they had filled all those, but could come and eat off the regular menu.  I tried to make a reservation and she said they don't take them but do accept call-ahead.  I called at 5:45pm for a 6:30 arrival.  The rude girl on the phone said they were not on a wait, so they couldn't accept a call-ahead, so call before we come.  I called again 10 minutes later, and the rude lady said they were on a 45 minute wait (in just 10 minutes time??), and reluctantly took my call ahead.  We arrived at 6:30pm, couldn't find a place to park, and when we entered the waiting area was packed full.  We approached the rude lady at the hostess stand (don't know her name) and told her we had a call-ahead.  She didn't even react, handed us a buzzer, and sighed.  After 45 minutes, I went back up and asked what was going on, and she just said they were very busy and shrugged her shoulders, and immediately turned to the other hostess next to her and started talking as if we didn't exist.  After 1 hour and 15 minutes, I went back up to her and asked if we were going to be seated ever, and she said it shouldn't be much longer.  When I expressed my discouragement and told her that we had called ahead as instructed, she said "call ahead is just a courtesy".  Wow.  I didn't know that as customers we were inconveniencing the restaurant by going there and spending money.  Then, after 1 hour and 40 minutes, we were finally sat.  Whew!    Clearly, they have many aspects down nicely, but possibly the most important thing is the greeting both over the phone and in person by the hostesses, and in this respect, they are terrible.  The hostesses (or at least the one we were dealing with) was rude, short, seemed confused and over-whelmed, and generally could not have cared one way or the other if anyone that came in was waited on and greeted properly, and she obviously could have cared less if anyone actually stayed.  i wonder if she realizes that her bad attitude and obvious lack of training could keep people from coming back?    I know that I will have to think about coming back again, even though the servers and food are excellent, I am not sure I want to deal with chaos and rudeness again just to get it, when there are MANY other places in Ballantyne that can provide good food AND good service.  After spending almost $200 on dinner, I feel as if I was taken advantage of, just because of the confusion and attitude at the front.

zawm2NJi0ptjYru2gI9h9w.text: Went to Vine for Easter brunch with a party of 13 including four small children. Our table was ready when we arrived and we were able to feed the kids right away. There was an ample buffet with a great variety of salads, pancakes, eggs along with beef and ham cut to order. A suggestion.....get the shrimp and grits, it was delicious. There were several omelets you could order from the menu. Our sever did a great job especially when you consider the small kids. A great experience!

cRUIzpGRhIemyltGKEgGig.text: Had lunch today with a large group. Service was very good. All menu selections came out in a very timely fashion. I had  the French dip, nice portion. Not crazy about the au jus. The meat was tasty and plentiful.   My wife had the pulled chicken sandwich; was not fond of the sauce that was used. The ambiance is very nice. They did a great job on the interior. When we were done the management provided all attendees, about 20 with a complimentary chocolate chip cookie, nice gesture.

rnTyQgR-ynO55i7DiWjejw.text: Traveling to Charlotte on business I was recommended Vine for dinner. I decided to try the barbecue ribs and they were fantastic. This is a nice classy relaxing place.

ueoJd274KBnXPKD5GBV59g.text: I have been here twice with my husband. Both times, we have had the most amazing food. And unfortunately, both times we have had so-so service. This last time we got our appetizer after our entrees arrived, we had to ask twice for bread plates, we were served our salads twice. Clearly, the front of the house needs better management in order to highlight the super good food.

_g6uv2DKm--xh4d1CkRCbg.text: I'll make this short and quick:  1) Service was poor, never suggested any lunch specials. 2) Server unpleasant, zero personality. 3) Server unavailable/disappeared after different staff delivered food to table. 4) Waited several minutes to get requested extra dressing for dry salad & some Parmasen cheese for pasta dish. Which, by the way, should automatically be offered when serving a pasta dish. 4) No refills on beverages. 5) Only time the server came back to the table was to ask if the bill was to be split. 6) Never ask if we were interested in dessert and coffee. We had intentions of having both but after the feeling of being ignored we decided against them.  Try The Vine if you want to but my experience will unlikely bring me back. 131 Main St. is a far better choice, always friendly, helpful, food is great and consistant .

bO1D-tVL6SmnmMs1x6nEtg.text: The food and wine at vine will not disappoint you. The atmosphere detoured me for a while but now when I go we just sit at the bar which is a better experience and the service is great.

Ixlnqiui7EBSf9wchQ227A.text: Romantic ambience or if your like me visiting for a work dinner, upscale atmosphereperfext for taking clients. Good local beers on tap and a decent wine menu.  They are known for their crab cakes which were awesome. Lump crab meat with a spicy ramulade. I tried their blue cheese chips and had a vine salad which were both good. Several people I was dining with got the prime rib which looked amazing. I think they only serve it on specific nights. Sorry I missed exactly when that was but we were there on a Thursday night. The service was great. I'll definitely be back!

9BqfVTCCJfO0ca96eR_ZiA.text: Professional and friendly staff. Good menu .  We got excellent recommendations from our waiter and enjoyed our meal.

JDwZCSgdt6HWZJUc9l1AXg.text: I recently had lunch at Vine with a coworker. The food was good, but the restaurant felt dated. I had a salad which I really enjoyed, and my coworkers had a macaroni and cheese dish.   Our waitress was friendly, but she did not keep our drinks full and we had to ask another waiter/waitress for her several times.  I would not be opposed to eating here again, but I also wouldn't seek it out.

ex9kFcugrQls_W2t8IubwQ.text: I went to Vine for happy hour with a coworker. The happy hour food menu is extensive and reasonably priced. We ordered way too much food - but all of it was delicious. We both had a Juicy Jay to drink. The bartender was fantastic. He checked on us frequently and chatted with us for a while. I would definitely come back!

tbP8wM7qAZLsmJ2vYuAZVw.text: I dined 1/11/19 with a party of 19. Overall, our service was great. Our server, Caitlin, had her hands full but was very attentive with our needs. For. Appetizer, I had Calamari. They were lightly fried presentee nicely. For my entree, I ordered the Maryland Jumbo Lump Crabcakes with coleslaw and garlic mashed potatoes with a Caesar Salad. The crabcakes weren't filled with breading like typical crab cakes I've had from other restaurants. They were just the right size. Also, the coleslaw had a flavorful taste. I could taste the hint of cilantro added.  I'd definitely come back!

9gC3nrVsl2srAV1xEVBWUw.text: Came on a business trip & lived the ambience.  Great layout and an upscale atmosphere.  Very polite staff and the service was very good.    I ordered the scallop risotto at the recommendation of the server.  He assume red me that it was highly ordered and loved.    It SUCKED.  It was gummy, tasteless and dense.  The scallops were over cooked, but had good seasoning.

0SDtGDX6VPAFJaLqf0Ag0Q.text: Made a reservation for 2 at 6 pm on 14 June. Reservation was confirmed.  Showed up to find the restaurant dark, the doors locked and the parking lot empty. A FedEx delivery slip was posted to the door.  Unless I am totally wrong, Vine has closed for good.  There was absolutely no notice of explanation posted on the doors and no notice sent via Yelp. We went to another Ballantyne restaurant that had its lights on and a staff present.

O5Ysb69IT8BkziGJndrEMQ.text: There was a group of six of us that ate dinner and we were able to eat outside. Everyone was very friendly and the food was very good. This was one of the places we ate while on a business trip near Charlotte where the service was friendly and pleasant. Next time we are in town for work we will make sure to stop back in.   I

X0UbGT11dClMK8zK-PNUtQ.text: There were 3 of us and the 2 others gave their food either 4.5 or 5 out of 5. I have mine a 3 or 4 out of 5. I found that most of it needed salt. Like it was devoid of ANY salt. The best dishes were the crab cakes, scalloped potatoes with blue cheese,  buffalo chicken pizza, and greek salad.

Nu-VLSBh0IgRLk_Wufr8hg.text: Before going to the movies we were searching for somewhere near the movies to go grab a bite to eat. While driving i mentioned look boo that place looks interesting lets go! Im very seldom wrong,omg. The food here is phenomenal! I had the prime rib french dip. Baby, let me tell you! My bread was so soft it felt like a baby's bottom. What a way to describe food huh? My drink was bomb as well. The staff here was super friendly. Kevin our server was the best! Who knew we would run into a celebrity or two while eating here as well. Some of the panthers players were there partaking in some of their lovely dishes as well. Staff here was so friendly by the time we left the kitchen manager Tresha , and the restaurants manager was all sitting around having full blown conversations with us and even told us about the weekly drink and food specials they have every week.

Gvqg4Vuxdy69t3Ayy4eAqQ.text: On the positive side, they do have the best happy hour food and wine offering in the area.   We also had questions on how the sauce on the Cajun shrimp was made - it is amazing!.  To our surprise, the Chef came out of the kitchen and explained how to make at home, although held the spice proportions as a restaurant secret (Gotta respect that!)  I hate to give them only 3 stars, but this is for one specific reason:  Their beer on tap just tastes off.  I don't know if it is a failure to clean the taps, old kegs, or residual soap in the glasses.  I gave up drinking their draft beer and have been ordering bottled beer instead.  I haven't had dinner here in a while, but based on the happy hour menu, I am sure it still would be a positive experience.

IbHuj_tq_6hld2LXzjVo7A.text: Mehh, very expensive for very little return. Was not impressed that we had to send back the cornbread because it was partially raw. But I was extremely impressed with the manager he came over (we never asked for him) and brought us out a new one AND took it off the bill! Very nice customer service.  The food overall all though was not very flavorful.

bDO5rMdHCysYP8ctdDsmBg.text: Great place to dine at. Good for special occasions or just a night out for dinner. Their food is farm to table and you can tell with the taste. Also their menu is constantly changing, so you never get bored.   Great bar, fireplace, and overall atmosphere

pw8EbhOlsafdMilakXW-8Q.text: Went here Friday night got a table in about 20'mins. Sat at bar got a bad vibe from bartender, he was less than inviting, actually seem bothered. Took about hour and a half to get dinner after we sat down. Wife's streak was perfect, mine was well when I ordered med-rare.  They took the steak back and brought another one in about 5 mins which was completely raw, not even edible. They took it off the bill.  Good wine list everything else was pretty bad. If want a relaxing dinner with the food cooked right, go to firebirds or 131. The lack of basic service and having to get aggravated at that point matched up with the empty restaurant.  First time last time.  Spend your money somewhere else.

x7ggyHajfRlMP9R1V-cezw.text: I heard really amazing reviews about this place but I found it to be mediocre at best. I got the special of the night which was halibut served over an Asian bok choy. It was ok - not much flavor in the seasoning of the fish or in the sauce over the bok choy. My husband ordered the pork chops which were...well pork chops. Nothing to write home about. The highlight of our meal was the steak lettuce wraps and bbq shrimp. They both had loads of flavor and we would highly recommend.

oKfmfW1VaCuT-rwR2JOslQ.text: My company had our annual Christmas party here so we visited for lunch. We had our own private room which was nice. For a started I chose the tomato bisque. This was REALLY good. I'd revisit for this. For an entree I went with a burger. The burger was cooked well, but nothing about it really stood out. I went with cheesecake for dessert. It was just ok as it seemed like they had just pulled it out an extremely cold refrigerator as it was a tad difficult to slice through and did not slice smoothly. The crust was also entirely too thick and many people did not eat the crust at our table. The staff was good for the most part except they gave a coworker's burger who ordered theirs as rare as possible to the wrong person. The experience here was middle of the road so I would visit again if I'm nearby but I would not travel here specifically.

HJpHBIld9MUXXl5yq__Pbg.text: Food is good. Nothing terribly special but it's good and hot. The staff is very knowledgeable and offer suggestions regarding menu items.

qHgPTG9FFH7dq-eYlAuDtw.text: Had an excellent experience with Vine American Kitchen for my son's Wedding Rehearsal Dinner six months ago, and now just writing this review.  The service and food was impeccable and would highly recommend Vine American for any festive occasion demanding quality food and service.

SVULKKqQZayeDgUg-7JmaQ.text: Someone needs to tell your bartender that when someone orders a "vodka", that means and well vodka and not a $9 Tito's. What a rip off. I'll never go back there and sure won't recommend it to anyone I know.

b8xj4UDJx0Pn6PeIq4Zezg.text: I've been here three or four times for lunch, and I would highly recommend the chef's lunch special.  Last week was a steak sub with marinara sauce and cheese - quite tasty!  Crabcakes are delicious with lots of meat and little breading.  Definitely a good place for lunch, with efficient wait staff and tasty food!

FQ2JyI8D7rIHwPWGFIHOAg.text: Went for Sunday brunch at 10:30, had to wait a few minutes for them to open the doors. The nice part of being the first/only people there is that you have your pick of seats. We chose outside. The temp was nice but the sun in our eyes got old. The umbrellas are very petite and not quite appropriate for the space. Most of my neighbors have patio umbrellas larger than the mini ones at Vine-they could stand to be upgraded.   We ordered beignets to start. They were good but not awesome. A little lighter and less doughy than True Cafe du Monde beignets, and lacking the thick layer of powdered sugar on top.  Several table members got the apple cider pancakes and thought they were quite good. Definitely gigantic! I had the lump crabmeat hash. Again good, but definitely not awesome. The crabmeat was indeed big glorious chunks of sweet blue crab. The crabmeat chunks were mixed with brunch potatoes on the bottom, and then topped with 2 sunny side up eggs and finished with a bit of hollandaise. The hollandaise helped bring some flavor to the plate but there wasn't much of it. The blandness of all those potatoes coupled with the eggs really needed some zing to elevate it. More spice, more flavor, more sauce, more something. There was nothing to marry the crab meat to the potatoes and eggs, so I found myself eating the crab by itself and then I was just left with boring potatoes and eggs.  By the time we left almost 2 hours later, the restaurant was about 1/4-1/3 full. Definitely not as busy as I'd expect for a brunch spot on a Sunday. Overall the group was happy to try Vine for brunch but we won't be rushing back again. The menu could use more exciting and inventive brunch items and could stand to get away from so many basics. Basic pancakes, basic breakfast sandwich, basic eggs & bacon. Even the apple cider pancakes looked boring as there was no finesse- no fresh whipped cream, etc. sort of just items slapped on a plate. And how can there be no French toast on a brunch menu?!

0q1xAJM_aT02ZT52894oSA.text: Awesome drinks, great dirty martini. The sliders are great and the guacamole is even better. I highly recommend them.

goBYJC8EJM-LdwXNTogWXQ.text: I just had the best night with the bar tenders! Holly and Ebony did a fabulous job! I felt like I knew them for years! They were super busy but watching them was like watching a well oiled machine! My significant other and I will be back not just for the banana bread pudding but to hopefully see them!

TfUjWj8GQXeJrvex91u7jw.text: Hosted a small meeting in Vine's Barrel Room and it was wonderful; perfect location, great food and premiere service.  Using the on-wall TV for my presentation was easy as pie.  Melissa Sveda and everyone else at Vine could not have been more accommodating.  Thank you for helping make my meeting great.

YR0DuXWrFkRCIsEvn58i2w.text: Been a couple times now, and most of the food is pretty good. Didn't love the crab cakes. Service is the biggest issue. Totally clueless and indifferent. Highlights have been calamari, blue cheese chips and salmon entree.

tw5C2UKdU5uVQKlvkQoY7g.text: We had a great ladies night at Vine. Our Server Was Super nice. The food was good and the drinks were ok. Service was a little slow in the beginning which I was surprised about since their were less than 15 patrons in the whole restaurant,  but she took our orders things moved along. She was very attentive. We had a fairly large party of 10 or 11 and some were a little finicky but that didn't bother her.  She also split all our checks which was awesome!

Ky2FGWUhdZEx_Bjn1ypulA.text: I've been here several times before and the food has been really good. Today, I went with a very large party for brunch and while the food was great, the service left much to be desired. One of the waiters was rude and didn't seem interested in making sure we had what we needed at all. In addition, he initially refused to give us the kids menu, though we had already ensured ahead of time that a kids menu would be available. Once we requested the manager, he returned not with the manager, but with a kids menu. Really?! The brunch menu is also not one of the stronger ones in Charlotte. One group in our party also ordered the beignets (which are normally fantastic) but someone in the kitchen accidentally covered them in flour instead of powdered sugar. When they brought it to the waiter's attention, he argued them down that nothing was wrong with them. Only after taking them back to the kitchen did he come back out and apologize.  I will likely return to Vine, ONLY because I have had great experiences before. However, many people in my party who had not been there before will likely not return.

l8TjbpBh3Zf03RbYVywGxQ.text: I had a business dinner there last night.  The filet "special" was so chewy one of my guests had to spit part of it out and the demi glaze on top if it was lumpy and cold.  The service was bad as described in other reviews.  The waitress didn't tell us about the special - the manager did when he brought our wine.  When we later asked her about it (maybe this was a sign) she looked like it was the first time she had heard of it.  In addition she took forever to take our order then brought out salads WITH dinner.  I was completely embarrassed for my recommendation and let them know it was based on location as I had only had appetizers and drinks there before.  I won't be returning.

nrdIy7UroKT-J0OIJUt4jg.text: Went here in a whim. Good food. A little pricey. The desserts are to die for though! Nice bar area and a special room enclosed for small special event. Really nice atmosphere

hblziwbNAjB5HUPKBOi9jg.text: We went to Vine as a group two days ago. I got the French Dip and it was delicious. The friez we ok but not great. I tasted my wifes jambalaya and it was alright not a lot of flavor. Service was quick and friendly.

X5OqJTmrRv21GtFgmO3LlA.text: Terrible service. Empty tables everywhere and still waited 30 minutes then waited 10 minutes for a waitress at the table. Not a dining experience comparable to other Charlotte establishments. Mediocre food.

pUodLIB7TQwY7C9cZA-PfQ.text: My wife and I sent to Vine recently to give it another shot as we hard they had a new Executive Chef.   We gave up on Vine after going there approx 6 times and found the food very inconsistent.       We did note improvement on the most recent visit (the corn bread for example was delicious).    This is a gorgeous restaurant. As with any restaurant the food has to deliver.   I'd say the food was good this time but not great.   We're going to give it one more try based on friendly service and terrific atmosphere.   Sarah our waitress was Excellent!

NPbL1DOU_Z_gXLJj3aL54A.text: Sub par service (wait staff, not just our waiter). Above average food and ambiance. Overall an ok, but not exceptional, experience. Would go back if this was the only restaurant in town. It isn't, so we probably won't.

kKtY6zPOwUfrAU-xKtv31Q.text: We went here for dinner for the first time. We had great salads and appetizers and our service was excellent. They have an amazing coconut cake dessert but warning it's so large it could seriously feed like 6 people! There Banana pudding is to die for made on a macaroon crust. Overall a nice spot with a great ambience if you're looking for a quick place for dinner with casual setting.

7azkGDCcTLDaLdpPBAdsBw.text: I like this place. Nice Vine salad and flavorful jambalaya plus great, friendly service! I'll be back.

-OCoAmzz1RFlSzrU1yONrw.text: Half priced wine bottle on Thursday helped. Food was ok. Service was ok.  Not something to run to.

gu-QyGFI_9Qr00oK7GU3qQ.text: Great service, great food, nice atmosphere. The menu is extensive but not overwhelming; I ordered the blackened shrimp salad and it was so delicious, and the muffin that was supposed to come with it never made it into the oven, so I was given the jalapeno cornbread appetizer instead! I appreciate service like that.Our drink glasses were constantly full and our waiter was friendly. We went at 1230 on a Sunday, which was a great time to go, because by the time we left around 130 it was starting to get more crowded. The restaurant was bright and comfortable inside.  I look forward to returning to Vine to try more of the menu!

usv5RyT-VevYaFd88mS0Nw.text: Always fantastic. On this trip I tried the pulled chic sandwich special with sauteed squash as my side. Both very good.

_3RuK3rJZyww8vsNQx1Bwg.text: Came here for a birthday dinner. Just about 4 people. It took our waiter forever to come greet us. It also took her forever to bring our drink back. My friend ordered a ginger beer and the waitress never came back. When she finally came back, my friend ask her about the ginger beer and the waitress said she forgot. How do you just say you forgot my DRINK ORDER. Smh. I ordered the jambalaya. It was okay. Nothing too great. My friends fries were cold. Maybe because the waitress forgot the food in the window. Then my friend's rib were so dry. It wasn't a busy night so I don't understand what was the big deal. Our waitress was training someone and I hope she gets someone better

UopcxMq2MzVdGtpiENdnfQ.text: Food is consistently good.  Service, not so much.  We always sit at the bar.  Big parties seem to keep service bar busy (like tonight).  But, it would be a 5 * rating if service at the bar was good.

MqplRoVmpUL1pLbH1Gek3Q.text: Dined at Vine American Kitchen in Ballantyne.  Great restaurant with strange menu.   $17 entrees with $200 bottles of wine (yes, higher entrees and lower wine available but the disparity can be very wide). EXCELLENT service.  Server wasn't very talkative, friendly or open, but VERY competent, knew how to serve wine properly (I used to work at Morton's The Steakhouse, I KNOW wine!) and was very available and willing to help with anything we needed.  Portions were large, food well prepared and tasty.  Perfect restaurant for a business dinner or casual family outing.  Burgers, pasta, salads all good.  Only regret, didn't have room for dessert.

2lOdHzq31x16kEeLYF5_9A.text: Most have been a slow night- Wednesday before Thanksgiving and we came with 3 very hungry children. Service was abysmal ! Over 45 minutes for the requisite grill cheese and chicken fingers. Drinks took over half an hour - and the place was about 25% occupied. Food was uniformly above average but the wait marred the experience greatly. Comping drinks was a poor compensation.

d2quAGyJzkOcUaRBl_vETg.text: Update: service and consistency have gotten better over time. Since that was my only hold-up, I've upped my rating.

2Vr0x85XFEDfSywiAdFc8Q.text: The food was the delicious. We had the chicken sandwich, cauliflower and brussel sprout hash, steak lettuce wraps, sweet potatoe fries, and friend green tomoatoes. Everything was hot and delicious. Service was good. The location in which we sat in the restaurant was hot and humid. We asked about adjusting the temp and I believe they did but it was still hot in the section...

dcTXCDJdjJKUKIhTKxU76g.text: Great restaurant. Food was great for the main meal but in particular the almond brittle dessert was amazing.  Service was great too.

80EaG5d33ouCSjvVqe7spQ.text: New Year's Eve dinner at Vine with a group of 10. JC was our server and she was epic. We're a tough crowd and she rolled with everything we threw out. Food was excellent from apps through desert. Highly recommend and definitely ask for JC as a server.

WR9mUxw1II-gDugv0jBgEQ.text: The food is great; you must get the BBQ shrimp app. The service provided by Marcus is  what made our experience! He was friendly and had great recommendation for both cocktails as well as the dinner menu. We will be back for sure!

LeAgg2_Zqio5sj4JfK8Zbw.text: Love! Great atmosphere, and great food. I highly recommend the pork chop. That's what I had, and it was delicious. Our waitress JC was the best!!

8yMw7wEtwQlC7PRJAdYl7Q.text: Had an early dinner on 12/20 with a friend.  We were seated immediately.  Our server checked in with us promptly and kept an eye on our needs, but we weren't pushed at all.  The food came quickly and was great (we only ordered salads and appetizer but I added a steak "to go" too).  Our server managed the tickets so that my "to go" meal was ready when we finished, so it was hot when I left the restaurant.  Our server even brought me a drink refill in a to-go container.  It was a really enjoyable restaurant experience.  Now, this is where it gets weird.  I left the server a large tip for extraordinay service.  He didn't put the tip through as a charge - maybe he thought I made a mistake   No, Josh -- you earned it, and I meant to leave that much.  I'm swinging back to the restaurant later to make sure you get the money.  Merry Christmas!

M0uahNegiReOzjmVtq14Ng.text: We had dinner there for the first time upon the  recommendation of the Ballantyne resort while attending a conference there.   The restaurant is nicely decorated and service was good.  I would have given 3.5 stars if Yelp allowed half stars but it was not worth four stars.  We started with the bbq shrimp  and fried green tomatoes appetizers.  Both were good but not great.  For dinner we had the jambalaya and grilled shrimp salad.   The jambalaya was very spicy as explained by the server and was great. The salad was good too, pretty basic nothing to special.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp salad
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Jambalaya - very good!

C_bFKjBeJxPRRlwfQUu6rA.text: Just want to point out that Vine has yet to receive a 5-star review. It's pretty clear to me now. We went as a last minute choice for my dad's birthday. We've never been to this building (I say building because it has been so many different restaurants over the years). I would figure this place gets plenty of traffic as it is situated right in the heart of Ballantyne. It wasn't full, though, on the Saturday night we went. In fact, I'd say only 50-75% of the seats were taken.  We were promptly seated and seen by a few different waiters before actually getting "our" waitress. I ordered ribs, my dad a hamburger, my sister chicken, and my mom salmon. After about 20 minutes, the food came out. Interestingly enough, my hand towel for my ribs came out 10 minutes before any food was served...which doesn't really make sense.   The food came out, and the first thing I noticed was how hard my ribs were. Usually, you can take a knife and break apart the ribs like melted butter, but this time, I had to bend back a rib, and cut it before it came apart. The meat was tough--possibly overcooked? I pointed this out, and it was quickly taken back. A new plate of ribs arrived about 15 minutes later, which was MUCH better, but still not great. While soft, there were fat nubs on the ends, and the sauce wasn't great. I think they were short ribs which are usually of lesser quality than baby back, which I was annoyed about. If I'm paying $19 for ribs (or whatever it was), I'd like good quality ribs.  They gave us a free dessert because of the ribs. We got the banana cream pie, which was just bad. The pie crust was not good at all, I took a bite and was done. Everyone else said their dinner was average as well.  Would I come back? Doubtful--this place left me unimpressed.

TyQ12GnMWjBB_0beD2gU_A.text: We decided to go to Vine because it was right across the street from where we were staying. I read some reviews and saw that the crab cakes were good so we decided to start with those. Although the portion was small, the cakes were outstanding. We're also Rhode Islanders and take our seafood very seriously. We had been traveling all day and wanted something light for our main course. Every entree looked good but we went for salads. I had the BBQ chicken salad which was outstanding. I would go back just for the salad again. The other salad we had was very forgettable and wouldn't go for it again. It had chicken, fresh greens, asparagus and roasted red peppers. Overall the atmosphere fit the style of food and we felt the drinks were very overpriced for the location. 4/5 just for the crab cakes and BBQ salad.

JFRjBOUszNVSaZVqXyzt8A.text: A very delicious dinner. Our server, Golie, was attentive and helpful. The food was great. I had the stuffed peppers and it was enough to feed two. The coconut cake is divine! Good music and helpful staff. I'm impressed.

w73Ek7Zt0TRnkFJfD5bfwQ.text: The service was good, however, we were disappointed with all of our food.  I had to send one item back because it was so spicy.  They were rather surprised I didn't ask for a box....not worth it....no way I was eating that food again.  My fiance had been there 3-4 times before and it was hit or miss.   After this miss, we'll not be returning.

7bB89wz--GNUrNqYJgHpFQ.text: Recently went here for a Christmas dinner hosted by my wife's company. From the looks outside I was really excited for what was to come but I was brought to reality once we were seated. The waitress we had didn't seem to interested in serving us even though we were seated in their Barrel Room. She would show up for a couple of moments then wouldn't be seen for another 15 to 20 minutes. I ran out of water on many occasions and all we could do was laugh because it had become ridiculous. The food was decent but not enough to make me want to come back with my wife on a private dining experience of our own.   I personally had the Atlantic Salmon even though I'm not a fan of farm raised salmon and how they're raised but because their menu didn't seem to inspire much confidence in anything else. The salmon was well prepared and the mashed potatoes were fine but oily.  My wife had the All Natural Rotisserie Chicken and she liked  the entree but didn't eat all of it; not because of portion size but because she also couldn't find anything else on the menu to order. So, Yes we settled.  Did I mention the waitress didn't show up to refill water glasses or check in on our party to see if everything was fine? Well, she didn't and well that's really all I can say about her. Otherwise, we had a wonderful time joking, laughing and getting to know new people who recently joined the company my wife works for. And if you're wondering whether I would recommend this restaurant to you...I wouldn't. I know there are better restaurants in the Ballantyne area and you would do well to check them out unless you're a risk taker.

-poHTOfsbV1_ABWDOuKw4A.text: Best happy hour in the Ballantyne area! $1.95 to $5.95 appetizers, and $5 select wine and beer. Monday through Friday 4 to 6. Service needs some work. But can't beat the prices!

oE4iPILOSchBkFHsqaF1pA.text: My co-workers and I are always on the lookout for a good lunch spot, so we were excited to try Vine.  The decor has a nice warm, upscale-comfy vibe which sort of reminds me of 131 Main.  We were seated right away - the restaurant is fairly large and there are plenty of tables.   One thing I noticed is that the water glasses are pretty small.  They bring water in a bottle  to your table, but with 4 people drinking it, it ran out pretty quickly. (The water bottle is not large & sort of looks like a wine bottle... which looked nice but wasn't very efficient.) Oh well, no big deal, they were pretty good about coming back and bringing more water as needed.   So, onto the food.... I ordered the vine salad (Field greens, cucumber, grape tomato, goat cheese, toasted almonds and white balsamic dressing) and I decided to add salmon to it.  Salads come served with a slice of Jalapeno Cornbread (which is skillet-baked with roasted corn, cilantro, and jalapeno butter).  The salad and cornbread were very good and the salmon was cooked perfectly.  ($7 for the salad plus $6 for salmon to give you an idea of price-point).   The service was ok, although our server forgot to bring one item that a co-worker had requested.  Overall though, I think everyone was pleased with their food and there were no major mis-steps, so we all agreed that we would like to go back and try more of the yummy sounding items on the menu.

wYhWTi0xPbohV39J9Kkebg.text: Great bar and staff. Wine list was above average.  Thursday have half price wine on regular menu, not on reserved list.  Great bar menu and prices are amazing.   Bar tenders were amazing! We will definitely be back!

Q34AP7IXp7DzJJSsBzfjAQ.text: We went to Vine on a Saturday evening around 6:30.  I had seen some other reviews about long waits, but we were seated right away.  The interior has a dark, cozy feel to it that's very similar to 131 Main as other reviews have stated.  The bar area looked like it had some comfy couches, TVs, etc., and the dining area was upscale casual - great for date night or a family outing.  As to the reviews about Vine not accommodating large parties, I didn't see any seating larger than a 4-person booth.  Our server (Lauren?) was fast and friendly and had some good recommendations.    We got the BBQ shrimp appetizer, which was solid.  I got a Pear and Bleu Cheese salad with chicken for my entree, and my fella got the salmon and asparagus.  The food was cooked well and was pretty tasting.  For all that and 3 glasses of wine, it was about $75, which seemed a smidgen pricey, but not terrible for a weekend night out.    All in all, Vine seems like a great addition to a neighborhood that seems to either have super casual restaurants (Bad Daddy's, Mellow Mushroom, Duckworth's) or super fancy restaurants (Global, Gallery).  I hope it sticks around since that location has been tricky for other places in the past.

T_eaI5KzVF_B1Yc_tGhK-w.text: Tried another round at the Vine - was Sunday brunch and was lucky enough to have a lady bug cooked right into my omelette. Waitress took it away and said "so sorry, I'll speak with my manager" - after nearly 5 minutes, it was apparent the manager wanted to stay away from a conflict so the waitress popped over and said "they're making you a new omelette" (I found it rather presumptuous to assume I'd want another after seeing a baked in lady bug in my first attempted omelette)! No thanks. Waitress dodged us like the plague after that but ran by saying the manager would be over to apologize. Manager did come over and gave a gift card to make it right. I wasn't angry or disgruntled, but when she asked if there was anything else she could get us, I simply responded, "our check" - 5 minutes after that, the waitress said we had no check - (again, good effort in making it right). I really WANT to like the Vine, but it's a done deal for me. No more and I'm really quite disappointed that I can't win there.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Look closely in the left ... You&#39;ll see my lady bug friend.

Nw-SZjoozLomD-q-2cZMhA.text: This was my first time here and it was absolutely amazing. I left full and happy and wanting to come back.   For an appetizer we got the BBQ Shrimp. There's only 5 shrimp, but it comes with bread to sop up the sauce - in my opinion that was the best part.   For dinner I got the Lump Crab Cakes. These were probably the best crab cakes I've ever eaten and I'm from New England. It came with Napa Slaw and fries, which were good, but not my favorite. I also ordered the skillet Mac and cheese, which was great also.   For dessert I got the new Oreo ice cream cookie sandwich. It was gigantic, so share. The vanilla ice cream was alright and wasn't the best, but that's the only criticism I have.   To drink I got the Chateau Wells Chardonnay and it paired well perfectly the entire meal.   Highly recommend this place.

2m_G7B75OXlRXFyrLh1Oxw.text: I've been wanting to try Vine for awhile, and now that we've moved to the South side of town I had my chance. The restaurant itself is very open and attractive. The booths are a bit on the small side when it comes to leg room, but overall comfortable. Our server was friendly and attentive. On a Sunday evening it was fairly empty, so you probably wouldn't need a reservation.   I ordered the ribeye with haricots verts and mashed potatoes. My husband had the roast chicken, macaroni and cheese, and a baked potato. His meal was definitely the better choice. The macaroni and cheese was served in a small skillet and the baked potato had a nice salt crust on the skin. My husband seemed to really enjoy everything, and from the bites I tried his was really tasty. My medium rare steak was overcooked and under-seasoned. I hate sending back something like that, but at nearly $30 I really wanted to get something I'd enjoy. Sadly the second time the steak was still not medium-rare but by then I was too hungry to complain, so I just ate it. As far as sides go the mashed potatoes were good but I'd skip the green beans, as they weren't anything special.   Overall I would return (specifically to try the Coconut Cake on the menu), but I wouldn't order the steak.

UY49888m0Y8yJFhwGvpMSw.text: Went for happy hour specials and the portions were a good size and filling. They accommodated kids very well. We came as a large group and our food came out pretty fast. We ordered almost every item on the happy hour menu and everything was pretty good. Only downfall the happy hour drink special seemed to be just juice  lol. Will definitely becoming back for the food though.

xyo3UD0HrWVMkCk5GZX5uQ.text: Vine American Kitchen, not sure where to begin.  I arrived at noon on Sunday, just in time for Bloody Mary time.  As I pulled into the parking lot there weren't too many cars so I was a little reluctant, but decided to go with my gut and give it a try.  Great design, with TVs, nice bar, but a little dark for brunch/lunch dining, but I can get their look for a nice dinner experience. Upon being seated I was greeted by a very sweet girl who took my drink order, water with lemon and a bloody mary.  The water was delivered and she said the drink was on its way, which it arrived not a minute or two later.   After reviewing the menu, I decided to get the Ballantyne Chicken Sandwich with homemade chips, which the waitress recommended. After ordering I "checked in" on Yelp and took a drink, whoa!!! Wholly whoa! All the drink was was pepper, with a old dirty brown piece of celery.  I stirred the drink and added some ice from water and it was overall okay. I love a kick, but this was not a good Bloody Mary kick, rather a PEPPER kick! My food arrived, and I pointed out the celery and asked that she replace it, which she did.  The chicken sandwich was pulled chicken with a red pepper aioli, red onions and arugula on a kaiser roll.  The pulled chicken was good, however, very bland. The kaiser roll was so soggy that I had to take the entire bottom off and only ate the top of the bun. However, the homemade chips, so good. I did add a little salt, but dipped in ketchup, too die for. Overall I thought the service was great, but the food could use some seasoning. I definitely will get back to try a few other items on the menu and will update my review if I feel it deserves better than an 'OK'. For now, that is where my thoughts stand.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ballantine Chicken Sandwich with Homemade Chips, cannot wait to dig in!
Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s Bloody Mary time !

qw5NEWgNSaVxWIXkU1qM-A.text: Vine is so-so.  The food was fine.  I had the crab cakes and shared the calamari.  The server was good.  The drinks were really over priced and took a long time to get (was a Monday night- not busy).  If you are looking for a safe run of the mill place Vine is fine.

ecEPz9inXXM-NNVTKaizQA.text: Easter Sunday Brunch was our first time trying this spot.  Food was great but I felt like the options were limited.  The best thing was the Greek salad.  The baked chicken and jambalaya were delicious as well.  It was  a little too pricey for what they offered, and our waiter seemed like he was out of it yesterday...forgot to tell us where to start with the food buffet after we sat down for a while.  He did not offer any refills for water, hot water for my tea, or coffee.  I will come back to give this place a second chance, but not for their brunch.

mDvswGKdVmQeT6SynSir-Q.text: They literally served me a cherry tomato that was so rotten it was starting to ferment. Turned me off big time and I lost my appetite. Took forever to get the fermented acidic taste out of my mouth. Waitress was MIA after that and I wasn't even a jerk or anything. Manager never even stopped by. Won't be back.

0oisFRGQVA5EhFSXSAPRDA.text: Not a fan.  I live close by and formerly frequented Vine on many occasions.  The place has steadily gone down over the past year.  The service is inconsistent and/or indifferent, the food uninspired, and you just get the general feeling that this is not a well-managed restaurant.  It's a shame because it's a great location.

XqA3k8xQoBEwdE6wfTfgfQ.text: Well this looks like its going to be repetitive salty food review.  The BBQ shrimp appetizer was sooooo salty, i mean my ankles were swollen by the time we left thats how dalty it was. We then just ordered the plain Margarita flatbread was tasteless, no flavor it was below average. Now lets move on to the service. The restaurant understaffed the bar with only 2 bartenders for 24 seats and also the service bar. We had to ask for every including water when our glasses sat empty for a long time. It wasn't 100% their fault due to being understaffed. With the several salty reviews i would definitely talk with the chef at a minimum. I hope they take these reviews seriously and make some adjustments.

iP8rv5sTQ13NLBf1XmwAkQ.text: Another week another bad restaurant. If like salt and I mean over salted than come here.  The manager was nice enough to give one of my guests desert which was huge  but we will never go again.

3PYqGLUbJEf2nrnIR8s46Q.text: The food was delicious and the service was great. Everyone was very nice and attentive. We will go back when we are back in town.

LuoytZuvmMF3dHUpCpHG5Q.text: I had family visiting for out of town and we needed a new place to try for dinner. I had heard mixed reviews about this place and it was close so I thought I'd give it a shot. I'm glad I did. It happened to be restaurant week. Half of us chose to order the Queens Feast while the others ordered from the regular menu. I ordered a filet which was properly cooked (not the best I've ever had.) my mom ordered crab cakes that were pretty good. Dad ordered the chophouse burger - I would get it again. My boyfriend ordered salmon and it was good too. The side items were okay. But the desserts made up for them. I ordered this butterscotch chocolate chip pie. I would get that over an over again. My boyfriend ordered the cheesecake. It looked basic but was so delicious!   The service wasn't amazing, but I cut her some slack because it was Saturday night during restaurant week.   Long story short, we will go back. I hear there is a great happy hour!

GeMlveEhiQxjUTA24mYxCA.text: A mixed bag review but the four stars is for the excellent service we received from Vine American Kitchen. Saturday evening we had dinner with a group of 10. They gave us a really nice private room to dine. Our server was friendly and took care of everything.    Service = 5 Star Food = 3 Star Decor = 4 Star  Food was a mixed bag. Some entrees were better than others. One thing to note is they don't have a kids menu. Just something to know if you are going with a large family.

8JdzZ391EesfC57Hm5V_lA.text: I just started coming to this place for lunch and after 3 visits I have become a fan.    The food is beautifully presented and the flavors are amazing.  The lunch prices are reasonable.  My favorite item here so far is the Blackened shrimp chopped salad.  It features many things you would expect in a cobb salad as well as avocado and 6 blackened shrimp on top.  The ranch dressing is mixed in but never overwhelms the salad like so many dressings do.  They have a daily $8.95 lunch special that changes daily.  One day it was salmon tacos and another day it was shrimp and grits.    The whole theme of the restaurant is wine.  They have wine dispensers at the bar as well as other bottled wine and often have wine specials.  Beer lovers, have no feer, they have us covered too and they have a couple of local craft beers on tap as well.  Seating can be very cozy here.  The seating in the main restaurant is mostly booths but they alternate in size.  There are a couple of separate rooms for more intimate seating - a round room to the back of the restaurant that can be closed off for groups and a smaller room behind the bar.  They have a great patio with a fire pit as well.  On my first visit, I was not really impressed with the service but it has gotten better in the next two visits.  And on my last visit, the shrimp for the salad were overcooked so there may be a little bit of inconsistency there.  But still, there are plenty of items on their menu that I still want to try so I will definitely be back.

8j7szEuc3iSwzWgVlziNJA.text: My girlfriend and I had dinner Saturday night and it was fantastic. The service was too notch and our server, Justin, made great recommendations for  appetizers and entrees. We look forward to returning soon. The crab cakes were amazing and I would go back simply for the crab cakes.

L0VhgoLLztC238aRAmaViQ.text: The staff is very attentive, friendly and fun. Food is consistently hot and flavorful. Great atmosphere and easy to have a conversation with friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Vine American Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

camK_y3UTBnYpq5Yc1KY-Q.text: We were really hesitant after reading the reviews and from our son's experience when they went in right after it opened.  But we were pleasantly surprised and satisfied.  Much is due to our waiter, Luis, who honestly answered our questions about pricing.  He is a great server and really took care of us.  It made our evening.  Comments on manhattan cocktails:  If you "call" a specific brand, as one reviewer did, the price is $11.25 each. I had a Hendrics martini for $10.  WWife had a glass of merlot for $7.   Many of the cocktails we saw on their specials ranged in price from $7 - 11.  The regular drinks were reasonably prices for restaurants at around $6 for mixed drinks.  Did like the menu, one where I found at least four items I wanted to try.  That is good news.  Wife had the filet mignon wedge salad, which was quite a nice meal with plenty of meat.  I had the center-cut filet and it was of such a good quality of meat that I could have enjoyed it raw.  Cooked perfectly and the loaded potato with it was a nice filling meal.  This was a first experience and we will return as Vine is a candidate for a four or five star rating.  Ask for Luis.

cFtpR0fRuWO4AEDBZst5tg.text: I loved the atmosphere, service and most importantly the food. Nice place for lunch and/or after work happy hour spot. Make sure u try the fries green tomato. This place made me a fan of them!

q_W-zJAHQI8z7sN8ZDu5CA.text: Get the crab cakes you won't be disappointed. They have great happy hour specials and always a classy spot.
